Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cozy, comfortable, with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: EMPedersen
Reviews.Content: A wonderful B&B with a great pool area and a pleasant continental breakfast. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was truly memorable. A place that we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: ptb123
Reviews.Content: we paid top price as we were there over spring break, but it was a BIG disappointment--very sm. room, poor upkeep, lousy bfast offerings--g8 location, though and nice courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location just off Duvall”
Reviews.Author: kar-ake
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in January. We like to walk so it was a perfect location to walk to all the attractions. Our room was small, and especially the bath but we had a private balcony which we enjoyed. On site parking was nice, we parked our car and never drove until we left. Over all we were quite satisfied with the room and out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Janine H
Reviews.Content: Chelsea House was clean, spacious and great location. Very near to all we wanted to see - Hemingway Home, Lighthouse and beaches. Easy walk to Duvall St., Mallory Square, Truman Annex. Loved the quiet and wholesome setting here. Comfortable and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: IP3806
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Duval St but not in the 'thick of things'- small rooms with shared porches/balconies. Continental breakfast was very basic- front desk staff quite helpful- felt it was expensive for what you got

Reviews.Title: “The room was like a closet.”
Reviews.Author: Ethel S
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Chelsea House and were given room 28 which has a double bed. The bed was almost as wide as the room. The bed was pushed up against the wall and there was no room for a night stand. I used a cooler we had taken to put our glasses on. We used our cell phones to tell what time it was because the alarm clock (which went off at 4 am) was on the other end of the room. The room was clean the bathroom looked like it had been just been updated, but it was too small. At $250.00 a night ( which they say is the going price for a room in the Keys) we could have stayed at a Marriott with two beds, a night stand and coffee in the room. By the way, we could not get coffee until 8am in the morning. We have stayed at b&b before and there is always coffee available. They said the continental breakfast was at 8am and it was exactly 8am. We were not the only ones looking for coffee in the am. It seem like they think it is more important to make all the money they can without any concern for customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable quiet setting”
Reviews.Author: Bubbadogs
Reviews.Content: One must remember that The Chelsea House is old. There are much needed repairs to the buildings, but nothing was noted that interferred with our creature comforts. The continental breakfast was not quite a full continent and could never be ready 1 minute before 8:00 a.m. no matter what the circumstances. The grounds are very beautiful with lots of trees and plants that would sudder at the thought of moving "up north." Room servicing was very slow (4:00 p.m.) everyday and the floors still needed sweeping (all hardwood or tile). The private porch was a wonderful escape from the traffic noise. Our "suite" was large and comfortable. The bed was not the best, but we did sleep well. The television needs help--would turn off at the slightest jar. The kitchen was a nice touch but needed additional items if cooking was desirable. The full size refrigerator was a plus. Was within comfortable walking distance to Duval Street and the bay side restaurants. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. We were even offered a place to freshen up on day of departure due to a late flight and check-out was 11:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Max979
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West from the UK, and we are probably not very knowledgeable about room prices, but this was the most expensive room on our trip (over $200 - prepaid) for a tiny room (even by our European standards). The bed was over soft, and the bedcover unpleasantly stained. Breakfast was very poor, if in a nice setting. In short, great location, and I'm sure there are nice rooms, but we didn't have one of them. It's the kind of place that sends you scurrying back to the dull but safe chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area, nice breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: gazebogal_50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location, near Duval (3 blocks) but far enough away from Mallory Square (about a mile) to be quiet yet walkable. The pool area and decks were nice with a good choice of shade or sun. The continental breakfast offered variety and well chilled milk and juice. The staff was very helpful. We stayed in a room that was on the ground floor (Three rooms in a row). The floor and the room were just very DAMP. It didn't seem to matter how we set the air conditioner. the floor tiles were actually slippery at times. Maybe it was just the climate that week, but I would request a room on a second floor or above if I were to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Betsy D
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the staff very helpful. However, the beds were very hard, as well as the pillows. We had no working phone in the room which was not corrected in a 6 night stay. Therefore when tiolet tissue was forgotten as well as a bath at and additional towels, we had to walk to the next building to inform the staff. Also I did not realize that it was a continental breakfast until I got there. That was a big disappointment to me at a place that advertises as a Bed and "Breakfast". When I have stayed at other such establishments there were very special cooked brerakfast. Even the fruit was only apples every day. The pool did not feel heated and when we asked if the temperature could be increased, we were told there was no one available to do this. For the cost, it did not meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea House..... great !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carol D
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how glad I was to pick Chelsea House for my 2 night stay.... I have never been to Key West before and it was a little scary to choose a lodging sight unseen..... what a joy from beginning to end.... The residence was lovely.... beautiful grounds.... lots of parking... and the staff so friendly and helpful.....just a few blocks from Duval... and great local diner... Duffy's..... loved it.... I will definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: FrSir
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, comfortable, with character ++ Staff was very pleasant, friendly, and as helpful as could be. Parking and location, excellent. Made my rare time away from the daily grind just perfect - Thank you Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “This place has charm”
Reviews.Author: LaraTee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Chelsea House in April 2011, and we'd definitely stay here again. It's a great location. Only 5 minutes to Duval Street. And it's supposedly haunted. We stayed in part of the attic that had been converted to a bedroom. Talk about charm. Not too expensive, very comfortable, continental breakfast, great location, friendly and helpful staff. What more could you want? And it's supposedly haunted. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, small room”
Reviews.Author: Heather L
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Chelsea house in Key West was a wonderful experience. The location is perfect; 5 minute walk to Duval street, 20 minute bike ride to Smathers beach. No car needed, we walked and biked everywhere. Staff helpful, breakfast was simple but good, pool was clean and well maintained. The room was tiny, but expected of a historic home. Definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room, and great value”
Reviews.Author: rag203
Reviews.Content: On a recent weekend stay in Key West, my husband and I wanted a place with Key West charm that was also affordable, within walking distance to the main areas, and preferably included parking and breakfast. The Chelsea House fit the bill for all of the above. As a converted home from over 100 years ago, Chelsea House is now a charming small hotel with beautiful grounds within a block of the Duval Street action. There is plenty of parking, which is unusual in Key West, and an adequate continental breakfast served daily at the secluded pool. The room includes a fridge as well. Our room was quiet, despite being on the busy Truman Avenue, and opened onto a beautiful porch. I see many complaints of dampness in the rooms. This is Florida, and this is an old home without central air! Being a January stay, the heat and humidity was mild I so I will say we did not have this issue. Previously living in central Florida, I know you can never get rid of all the moisture issues! Overall, the staff creates a laid back, friendly Key West atmosphere. Don't expect a place with meticulous housekeeping. Do expect a clean enough charming room in a great location with good value for the town.

Reviews.Title: “So much to like...”
Reviews.Author: bulldogNYC
Reviews.Content: Very lovely folks running a handsome trio of houses, all gathered together under the name Chelsea House. Having three properties allows the ultimate Key West luxury - free parking on site! We drove down from Miami, which is scenically exciting - and 3-1/2 hours long. But once we arrived we never used the car again. The staff is friendly and very helpful, with suggestions and cheer and grace. Breakfast was OK - mostly toasted goods and dry cereal, yogurt and coffee. No fresh fruit, which seems a terrible oversight. Tables surround the small but attractive pool, and the grounds are handsomely landscaped, so breakfast was cheerful. The only negative was our 3rd floor room. One climbs an incredibly vertiginous, narrow stair to reach the former attic. The rooms are small, the sloped ceilings threaten your head at every turn, and the bathroom was almost nonexistent. There was a lovely terrace with a fine view outside our room; if the weather was warmer we might have slept out there. But it was cool, and the room lacked any heating facilities. We would happily stay here again - if we had our choice of rooms, either on the ground or second floor max.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not in the allocated room”
Reviews.Author: Iancrowson
Reviews.Content: We prebooked online. Key West hotels are expensive and Chelsea House is one the cheaper. We were not expecting anything too good. On arrival the room we were given was awful. The smell of damp over powering, there was not even acupboard in which in which to hang clothes, just two hooks on the wall. A small room with a cheap mattress. We just could not stay in such a room and were told that actually we had already been up graded! Wow. We were shown another room, smaller and not much better. We asked for our money back and then were shown a really nice room in one of the main houses. The staff are friendly, helpful and understood our point of view. The hotel is well situated for Duval Street. OK breakfast, cereal, bread, juice and coffee, choc or tea. The main points I would make are make sure you get a room in one of the two main houses, not out back in various add on tin roofed structures. Don't expect a lift or help with bags. Don't expect super clean modern bathrooms. Don't expect your bed to be made very well, no clean sheets every day. Expect a charming old house and friendly staff near the centre of action and you will have good stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mary p
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. We were put in the Attic of the house which had slanted ceilings and a very very small room. They apologized becasue they realize that it is substandard room , but offered no discount. It had a full bed that was very soft and was too short. The room was substandarded and did not come close to what the web site showed. Since it was the holiday, we really did not have another option but to stay. They would not give us a discounted rate for the substandard room. The front desk was not helpful. To end the not so wonderful stay, we wanted to check out 1 hr later and they would not let us. Over all, not a good experience and would not recommend. The web site and reviews made not mention of this and I felt they misrepresented themselves with the accommodations provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PelleasPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Great spot. Within a very easy walk of all the Key West stores and bars, but far enough away to be totally quiet. One of a set of hotels under the same ownership on the same street. A large old house converted to a hotel. Charming but certainly aging. A nice decently priced find but not for people who need serious romance or modern luxuries. Great if you are here to see the town and want some charm.

Reviews.Title: “One of Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: brud8
Reviews.Content: Old Key West charm- cluster of three well maintained , white Victorian style buildings remodeled into rooms of every type and description- very quaint and relaxing- not a "cookie cutter" chain operation- makes you feel like your living in Key West- fair price- free private parking- walk to just about everything- breakfast included- Hemingway would have loved it

Reviews.Title: “Good location & very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room on the first floor with a bedroom area and a sitting room area. The room was very clean and neat. Staff was very cheerful and helpful. Breakfast was continental, but adequate. Best part is that you are within walking distance to everything. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tennispro42
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights on the WEB and pre-paid so we were stuck (AND it was not inexpensive). The photos look nice but our room (3#) which was categorized as a "Superior Queen" was a complete disappointment. The bathroom was tiny, with a hideous, stained yellow bath and white sink and toilet. The window had been sealed shut with plexiglass. There was no grout or sealer around the tub, the toilet seat and lid were scratched and hacked down to the wood, there were holes in the tiles where the bathtub faucets were installed and the rusty steel door hinges had stained the floor and wall. The toilet ran the whole time. There were no coat hangers, just 3 pegs on which to hang clothes and a rickety chest of drawers and no luggage rack. There were un-repaired holes in the wall behind the TV where previous attempts at installation had been made. The door frames were dirty and the paint was peeling. The curtains were ripped and the chairs on the porch were dirty; an ash tray containing a used teabag sat on the floor of the porch the whole time we were there. When we spoke to the "Manager" about this room, we were informed that "the house was old, and the Queen bed and a frig (it was actually an old wine cooler) gave this room a "superior" designation. Good grief! A house may be old but it can also be maintained properly. To call this place "tired" would be charitable. Since this Inn is rated 3 stars in the Triple A Book, we can only assume that we had the worst room or that the AAA rating is in error.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old house. Charming, but old”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: 3 nights early december this year cost around 180 USD per night, tax, service and breakfast included at the Chelsea House. It is part of the Â« Historic Key West Inns Â» partners. There are sereval like it around town, most of them not far from central Duval st. This is a little complex of 3 typical 1 storey Conch houses with front porches and upstair balconies, connected together with green paths. There is a pleasant pool area to the back where a simple but enough buffet breafast is selserved every morning from 0830. Not to mention the Â« clothing optional Â» sundeck for total sun exposure lovers. We like : -Charming old house. Old but charming. Room 26 is large and facing busy Truman st. Large and comfortable bed, nice bathroom with shower -Pleasant and polite staff -great, no fuss, pool area. Convenient breakfast, for a more than enough start. -2 parkings, free of charge for staying guests -2 blocks to Duval, 1 to 24/7 CVS and a self laundry. Enough choice of restaurants around We donâ€™t like : -Charming old and typical Conch house. Charming but old, with all the inconvenient that go with it. A bit of refurbishment for more comfort should be welcome, especially to reduce traffic noise from busy busy Truman, as well as room to room noise. -Not in room WiFi (move to the pool area or by the reception) -No kettle Tips : -Ask for rooms not facing Truman st where traffic is heavy -Of course, no lift, be prepared to carry your bigs bags through 90Â° stairs, or ask ahead for low level rooms

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Adults only”
Reviews.Author: hardhat47
Reviews.Content: I do not like being decieved. Booked at Chelsea House during Fantasy Fest and was assured that the property was 'Adults Only' (any responsable parent would not bring children to Key West during the Fest). I went so far as to call both the B&B and Key West Innkeepers (booking agent) to verify that the property was 'Adults Only' during Fantasy Fest, and confirmed that fact with both. At check in I saw several families with young children at the pool and waiting to check in and was informed that the property was couples friendly and only had a few larger units that could accomoidate families. As luck would have it that is exactly what they do. Pool had screaming children each day and made it off limits to all other guests. The front desk is used to lying to guests that complain about the families. If I wanted to be around children I would have taken my grand kids to Disneyland and not to an adult venue like Fantasy Fest. Property misrepresents facts and makes no apologies once you are checked in. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: emzieandnigee
Reviews.Content: This is close enough to everything. Duval St is a 5-10 minute walk. so close to all o the bars and restaurants. Hotel was nice old house style. The room was big and clean and there was a large balcony where we could sit outside. Pool was very nice and uncrowded. Breakfast was basic and a little of a let down. It was just pre packaged cereal, yoghurt and bagels with a toaster to use.

Reviews.Title: “nice bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: jaylena
Reviews.Content: typical old house all stairs and corridors well located for deval street room was clean and comfortable stayed for two nights complimentry breakfast was a waist of time very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Jim8966
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in room 17 with our 6 year old.The room was plenty big enough with 2 king beds. The bathroom was big to with a great shower. The staff were friendly and helpful.The pool area was great and seemed to have it to ourselves most of time.Pity the weather was dreadful for 4 days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Find in Key West”
Reviews.Author: B0bsiba0k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this cute hotel for three days and two nights. We took the least expensive room but it was more than adequate. Everything was clean and in working order. Good shower. Comfortable bed. A/C was a little noisy but we didn't mind it because the location was so good that we walked everywhere and were exhausted by the end of the evening. Pool area is small and one cannot do laps, just get wet and splash around some. Continental breakfast was more than adequate with bagels and other breads, muffins, cereals, fruit, coffee, etc. This was our first stay at the Chelsea but we will be back as often as we can. No other place in Key West is as convenient and cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Charming old historic house in good location”
Reviews.Author: mayalinda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice this year - on second visit I was remembered and welcomed back. The staff was able to answer my questions about the area and make restaurant recomendations. The continental breakfast by the pool is a great way to start the day and save a few (meal) dollars. The in room refrigerator is convenient for snacks and beverages - your preferences, not a pre-flled mini bar with ridiculous charges. There is also (limited) free parking. I'll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Decent hotel. Your mileage may vary.”
Reviews.Author: Will B
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Duval, Chelsea House is close enough to the action to make it convenient, but far enough away that it's fairly quiet. Located on US1/Truman Avenue, it is a high traffic area, but as long as your room is not facing the street, this is not a big deal. Like many converted hotels, the rooms at Chelsea House vary in size, location, amenities, etc. more than a purpose-built hotel. Therefore, any reviews you read may be colored by where in the hotel people stayed. This was our first stay at Chelsea House and we were there during the slowest month of the year (September). We had reserved a queen bed room, but were upgraded to a king room because of the relatively low occupancy. We were there for 5 nights. Three buildings make up Chelsea House; two "houses" with rooms on multiple levels and a third building that we have not figured out what it's orignal purpose was. Our room (number 31 aka "The Conch Suite") was in this third building. It is located between the two main parking areas. There are four rooms in this building (two on each floor) with the outside facing Elizabeth Avenue. Our room was the first floor inside room facing toward the pool side. The suite consisted of two rooms separated by a partial wall. You open the door to a small sitting area with TV, two chairs, and a table. There is also a min-fridge. The bathroom was tiny with a small shower, pedestal sink, and toilet contained in a 5'x6' space. Yep, it was THAT small. The bedroom held a king bed, small dresser, large closet, and secretary. There is a safe in the closet. We also had a porch with two chairs and a table. Everything in the room was functional and the bed was comfortable. Overall, the room needs updating, but it was serviceable. Cooling was provided by a wall mounted A/C that ran 24 hours a day. It kept the room quite comfortable and provided white noise. The bathroom was clean but there were several broken tiles and it could use some maintenance. There is apparently one water heater servicing all four rooms in the building, so showering was an adventure in highs and lows (temperatures, that is). The sink is small and there is nowhere to put a toiletry bag or even your toothbrush. The biggest complaint we had was that the small flat screen TV is located in the sitting area facing the two chairs and it is not visible from the bedroom. We weren't there to watch TV, so it wasn't a big deal, but we are used to being able to watch the news or weather when we get up. The people were helpful and friendly as were the two resident cats. The pool is small and shallow, but is PERFECT for relaxing. The "garden" that surrounds the pool offers shade for at least part of the area for most of the day. It was 10-15 degrees cooler around the pool than in the sun. Breakfast is typical continental fare with bagels, english muffins, fruit, cereal, yogurt along with coffee, juice, and milk. The most unusual thing about the breakfast was that it does not begin until 8:30. Coffee was out by 8am most mornings, but if your plan is to get an early start on the day, then you'll be eating somewhere else. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay at Chelsea House and would consider it for our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint place to stay and close to Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: DebMCNT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for Labor Day weekend. The stay wasn't bad. We were rarely in our room, but it was clean with plenty of towels each day. It is also on the quiet section of town which I really liked. I personally wouldn't want to stay on the party end of Duval - even a few streets away as this hotel is. We got in late on Friday. They left the key for us in a small lock box and told us via phone where our room was located. They left a letter with instructions and a map of the property which was very helpful. We had to park on the street, but luckily found a spot right on the street in front of Chelsea House. We didn't even move our car - we rode our bikes or walked the whole weekend. They have bike racks for you as well - so don't forget your lock! We checked in Sat morning before having the breakfast. Beth was very helpful and gave us quite a few pointers (and coupons!) on places to eat and things to do. It was a pleasure talking with her. The breakfast was not very good. Very plain with limited choices. I realize it is a continental breakfast, but the items were not "special" as would befits such a neat, older house. The items weren't from one of the stellar restaurants around but seemed like they came from Sam's club. Based on that, the next two days we were here we ate out. The only other issue was the bathroom. The shower curtain was too short so water pooled on the floor. I did love the HOT water though! We took quite a number of showers each day because you get hot and sweaty touring around during the day and have to clean up for dinner. We would stay here again if it were just us. We would not bring our kids here - it is a very quiet place (which is what we wanted!) and they wouldn't like it. We would just factor in the lack of a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Antoinette C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here many, many times in the past 10 years. We travel to KW 2-3 times a year. The original staff was great. Apparently new owners or management are running it now. Everything was pretty much the same at our last stay with the exception of now children are allowed to stay there and the staff is dowright rude. They were upset and hassled us our entire stay because my husbands last name and mine are different. They said they couldn't understand why our names where not the same. They said the deposit cc given had to be the exact same one that we paid for the room with. We also had issues extending our stay. Took us 3 days to get that straight over the phone. We have since moved on to places that want to take our money and aren't concerned whether our last names match. It is clean and has a nice pool area. It's in a decent area. Right off Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shells103
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Chelsea House a few times and I have never been dissapointed. It is convenient to everything, very nice staff very clean and comfortable. Also I felt safe staying there alone. Last vist I stayed in room 15 it is a small room but very cozy, my favorite room so far. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I dont know...”
Reviews.Author: Ansik
Reviews.Content: I am sure i would have felt better about this hotel if the reception staff where friendlier. I did not feel welcome at all when we arrived, and the few questions i had to ask, she could "not be sure about" or " didnt know". The rooms where quite good, but the bathroom where the worse of all that i had seen trough this US trip. Though it was ok, but low standard. The pool in the backyard of this hotel was though very good. If i ever come again to Key West, i will go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: corelin
Reviews.Content: First stay at a b&b. Great experience. Clean room. Nice staff. Breakfast was ok. Ice machine was broken. Free parking. 2 blocks from Duvall and 1 block from 24 hr CVS and Dennys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Mike1Paris
Reviews.Content: Excellent "hotel" with character. Within walking distance of the major key west points of interest. Convenient parking (nevertheless not enough capacity for parking the cars of all hotel guests).

Reviews.Title: “Unlikely we will return after 3rd time there.”
Reviews.Author: soxfan00
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Chelsea House and we had previously stayed at the Key Lime Inn 1 time. Don't know exactly what happened no house keeping for 2 of the 3 nights we were there. (no reason given - "oh I guess we forgot") We were also under the impression that this was adults only, or at least no small children, this is not the case. (correct me if I'm wrong but I believe they changed this policy they also state on their website "best for couples")For the first two mornings we (and other guests) were trying to eat breakfast, there were several small children running around the breakfast area and splashing in the pool. (for a solid 2 hours starting a 8am) We ended up going back up to our room. IMO the property should update the website to reflect the child policy and not advertise as best for couples. Room was fine a typical of what Key West B&Bs are like. Property is well maintained and rooms are acceptably clean. Bed was a little worn out. Quick walk to all the activities. One advantage is they have their own parking - we ALWAYS ask when booking in Key West and factor into the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: QueenMash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a king room. The room was spacious and the bathroom wasn't as small as some of the other reviews had led me to believe. Great location for walking to Duval St. Breakfast served every morning around the nice pool. Only internet around the pool area...we were able to pick it up in our room a few times. Very clean and nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, yet worn & limited”
Reviews.Author: SeeHenry
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights leading up to the July 4th weekend. The Hotel had vacancies the entire time which allowed for sufficient parking(FYI there is a second lot off of the side street). Because of the limited parking throughout Key West, we chose to walk to sites and restaurants. Beware, humidity in Key West during the summer is high; prepare to dress as cool & casual as possible. The walk to see the festivities and sunset at Mallory Square can be long and exhausting; we quickly learned to walk slowly & mentally chill out. On the few block walk to Duval Street from the hotel, there is a 24 hour CVS and a Laundromat. Our room was adequate and quiet. The pool is small but well maintained. I always felt safe in and around the Hotel. Diverse guests: Straight & Gay couples, Families & many internationals. Wi-Fi worked only at pool area and lobby. Continental breakfast was very limited and became tiresome. Working the toasters requires patience and a sense of humor. Friendly staff. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag but Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir
Reviews.Content: We got a week package deal w/ one free night & a couple of free drinks & attractions. We needed free parking & they had it. Normally, I wouldn't rent a car 'cause there is virtually no place in town to park. Inn is not right near town but if you're able to walk, it's about 10-15 minute walk to "hotspots" on Duval. But it is a block from the quieter end of Duval. Staff was VERY nice & they upgraded us to a king room, which was good because I don't know if I would have wanted to pay $915 for anything less. Old room w/ wooden door & 2 big wooden windows (room 5) on 2nd floor, no elevator. It's a historic Inn, so it's not real modern. I liked it though. Decent sized bath. Bleach stain on drape. I didn't care; some might. One dresser w/ 6 drawers, not overly big. The only real problem I had was that there was no closet or amoire, nowhere to hang clothes but back of door. Pool area was nice. Breakfast outside near pool, same every day: cereal, yogurt, muffins, coffee, juice & apples, not bad, 8:30-10:30. Free wi fi in pool/patio area & in lobby, not room. CVS on next block. La-Te-Da's, cool gay/straight piano bar, not too far away on Duval.. A fun place. Got the 2 free drinks at the sister Inn Lightouse Court on Whitehead. They had a nice pool w/ cafe & bar across from Hemingway House. I'd have stayed there but they had no parking. Overall, I liked Chelsea House.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable vintage house”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay was short at this historic house. The room was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. The poolside lounging area and garden were very attractive and conducive to a relaxing get a way.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: dlj54
Reviews.Content: The room and bed were very nice. The staff was excellent. We needed extra pillows and Beth from the desk went out of her way to accomodate us. We forgot a credit card in the room and were called right away. Breakfast was basic but good. The pool area was very pretty and comfortable. The location was great for walking to the main sites of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: KellyL01
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a "B & B' before and I admit I was a little nervous. Would the rooms be as nice as the big hotels? Would the staff be as attentive? Would they have the same amenities? The answer: Yes, Yes, Yes. We stayed at Chelsea House in a beautiful King room. The bed was more comfortable than my bed at home-wish it would have fit in my suitcase to take home! We had a lovely front porch with rocking chairs where we enjoyed sipping on some wine in the evening when it cooled off. The pool was so enticing we had to make it our first stop! Our room was amazingly quiet despite being only a block or so from the chaos of Duval Street. The staff was amazing-it seemed that even if we were just thinking of something they made it happen! We went on a beautiful sunset cruise recommended and set up by the staff-it was one of the highlights of our trip! I would absolutely recommend any of the Historic Inns of Key West-already booked my next trip at Lighthouse Court and I'm sure I'll be giving you all another glowing review in October!

Reviews.Title: “Alittle too Quirky:”
Reviews.Author: DrewL1977
Reviews.Content: The PRO's: 1) It's in a great location. Only 2 short blocks off of Duvall St. Far enough away from the noise, but close enough to walk to the heart of that area. 2) The room was very nice, clean, & ecclectic. The whole feel of the room was minimalist but with vintage furniture. The AC worked great & we had a small balcony which gave a clear view of the immediate area. 3) A HUGE PRO.......Free Parking right on the property!! This just in case you haven't been shopping around is a huge deal for this area. 4) The property itself! The House itself is gordous! The property has a quaint smaller pool which is clean & very well enclosed from neighboring properties. THE CON'S: 1) The bathroom situation. OK in fairness this is an B & B and it's an Old House so obviously it wasn't built with 10 to12 bathrooms in it, but the sink was calmost completly clogged (water was very slow to go down & almost over-flowed by the time I brushed my teeth). This kinda of thing should've been checked before we arrived, because it's not like I'm gonna want some random person working in my room with all my stuff layin around. Also the shower is very small. I'm 5'10'' & only 185lbs & I couldn't even turn without hitting my elbow against the walls. And just 1 more thing about the bathroom. You should never....I repeat never!!! have a slatted door on a bathroom! Be advised courtesy flushes are a must. 2) BUGS!!! Our 2nd night we came back to our room to find atleast 50 (from what I was told) flying termites engulfing the lamp in the room we left on! It was so bad I literally had to carry the lamp outside to the balcony & wait 20mins or so for them to fly away! Then after going to sleep I suddenly felt them hitting my face & when I turned the light on another bunch flew right to the lights!! Once I killed the remaining scraggelers we didnt have any additional probs.....but then again we checked out the next day anyway. 3) The WiFi or lack of. The problem is this place advertises having free WiFi & they do, but only in there lobby or in the back court yard (outside). So unless your OK with the bugs & noise outside or OK with having zero privacy when you r doing your work or whatever. The Wi-Fi isn't there. FINAL IMPRESSION: The staff at the Chelsea were very nice & did discount our room to make up for the inconviences we experienced. And as a whole for the location & parking alone I would stay here again. However I'd still explore the other options based on the cons I listed.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Inn, however, it could have been great except for a few things.”
Reviews.Author: gab1234
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here two nights this last week for my birthday. We booked the king junior suite and when we arrived, it looked like the pictures I had seen beforehand on the internet. I was nervous booking here because I had read many so-so reviews. Now, I have to say that my review is also average. The room itself was nice because it had a tv, nice little kitchen, and a balcony looking onto the street. However, when I first inspected the bed (to check for bedbugs or anything else) I noticed a fairly large stain that could have been blood or some kind of food stain. Nonetheless, it grossed me out and I never fully got comfortable in the bed even after the maid changed the sheets. And it did not help that the bed, at least to my standards, was like a rock. Unlike other reviewers said, I did not see many bugs. I saw one ant in the bathroom, but that could have happened anywhere. There are large gaps under the doors but I took some of the extra sheets off the bed and wedged them in the gaps and turned the a.c. very cold to deter any bugs. My last complaint was the sofa in the room. It was a lime green and you could see that it was pretty dirty. I would not even sit on it. So overall, I am not sure I would stay here again only because I feel the cleanliness of the room was below par. However, it is a cute room and it is located very conveniently near Duval Street. The service was good and the breakfast was as good as any continental. Oh, and parking was easy and free. So I guess each person will have to decide what exactly they are looking for in a room when they make a decision about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “romantic, private & most impressive, off the beaten path hideaway”
Reviews.Author: dwn2earth_80
Reviews.Content: i wasnt sure about the b&b i had selected online, as i had never been to key west, but i knew i wanted to total experience of the locals...not some monstrocity of a 5 star hotel that you can get anywhere. little did i know how nice of a place i would be staying at... The Chelsea House Pool & Gardens is like 3 or 4 old southern mansions turned into a spa-like hideaway, just 2 or 3 blocks away from the main drag in key west(duval street)..i wanted somewhere we could walk to everything from, since we came in on the water. and also, while in key west, and unwinding my mind and de-stressing from life, i wanted to do no driving, as i planned to be grabbing a beer along every stop...we had a room overlooking the secluded pool, yet had the option of a nude rooftop sunning deck...it was a queen room with all the bear necessities...yet, luxurious linens and a complimentary breakfast buffet out by the pool every morning...it was a little pricier at $250.00 a night...for a 2/3 day vaca to unwind, it was well worth it!!! it was private, super romantic and very clean..and all within walking distance of EVERYTHING...literally everything that we had planned out to do while visiting...along with beautiful landscaping and 5 star service!! after our trip, they sent us a $50 off our next stay coupon, via email just to say thanks for choosing them...i have already planned my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Naddel1a
Reviews.Content: This is a charming and well maintained historic inn with lots of free amenities (pool, breakfast, parking) close to Duval but not in the middle of all the action. For me, this is all I could ask for in Key West. If you need a full service resort hotel go and get one... I cannot help but think that this hotel is totally underrated (#30 of 40 at the time I write this). Staff was very friendly - we got a free upgrade upon arrival, the breakfast offered everything I eat in the morning at a good quality and I loved the gardens between the houses. Walking back at night after going out on Duval and getting a good night sleep in a comfy bed and a quiet room add up to 5 points.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures are deceptive”
Reviews.Author: dlb1893
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two nights based on the pictures on the internet. The bathroom was so small that there was no room for bathroom necessities. When taking a shower the toilet seat would get wet, with the shower curtain closed. When closing the room door the clothes in the closet (no closet door) had to pushed back tight or the sleeves would get caught in the room door. The room was hot as the air conditioner did not provide ample cooling. I was highly dissapointed with the room, especially at the rate charged. On a good note the bed was comfortable. There was not enough space for two people in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review...”
Reviews.Author: chefwf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our 25th anniversary trip. The property consists of 3 old historic houses...old being the key word. Checking in, the front desk people were wonderful and helpful! We had a very large King suite, which at first glance was beautiful, until the bugs started to crawl at night. We are from Fla. originally, so we know bugs are part of the area, but the gaps in the doors, and the ripped screens only contributed to the problem...also ants were everywhere, no excuse for that ! We had to go out and buy bugspray, since the maid said they had none. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice, also had a balcony which we enjoyed. The pool area was beautiful, and the breakfast was very good . The maids were nice, but never cleaned anything!! They only made the bed and replaced towels. The glasses we drank from sat in the sink all 3 days, and garbage that was overflowing was not even emptied...we threw it ourselves. There also was a pair of someones underwear left behind our bed...ewww!

Reviews.Title: “It FELT like Key West”
Reviews.Author: chilenayboriqua
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my Husbands birthday and it was AWESOME! I'm so glad I chose this hotel because it was our first time in Key West, despite of it being only a 4 hour drive from our home. It makes you feel like you are staying in someone's mansion. I was terrified of the narrow hallways and stairs, but it added to the authenticity. I am still here so they were pretty secure, lol. The other con was that our room had a slanted ceiling. It was like an attic. It was weird but, again, it felt very "Key West Mansion." The parking lot got full but we always found parking somehow. We didn't require much service; we always leave the "Do Not Disturb" sign because I can't take anyone else cleaning up after me. We did ask for a lot of help and attraction advice from the front desk. The gentleman was very nice. I loved the shower head that was on the ceiling of the bathroom. The location is amazing. I didn't know it would be so close to EVERYTHING but it is. You walk down the street about a minute or two and turn the corner and everything is there. I can't wait to go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great island location and quiet get away.”
Reviews.Author: Whitegoggles
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, the rooms are open and airie and the poolside breakfast and lounge area are a great place to meet your fellow travelers and take a dip in the pool or get some sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: MO_AO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea House for a long weekend in April 2011. We had friends who were getting married in Key West so we also knew a couple of other wedding guests would be staying there. Overall, we had a great experience. The staff was helpful and friendly and our room was cozy and well-kept. We loved the breakfast outside by the pool and the pool itself. We parked our car for the weekend and never had to drive again as everything is in walking distance. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Diana050_11
Reviews.Content: This property was close to Duval Street so you could walk to everything. The room was tiny but clean. The bed was very uncomfortable. Breakfast was standard continental but okay. The staff was friendly and there was free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: Fikistein
Reviews.Content: Our room was old and run down. There was only one night stand, no closet, bath room shower head was defective, no place to put toiletries in the bathroom. Breakfast started at 8:30am; with an 8:30 am morning excursions, breakfast was NULL. When asked if we could pay to extended check-out in order to accommodate our late morning excursion return; it would have been nice to take a shower in the albeit crappy shower, we were told that they were full booked. However, the VACANCY sign was still hanging when we drove off later in the day, salty and all.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint!”
Reviews.Author: klordh
Reviews.Content: Every room had a porch to relax on. Breakfast was offered with a great selection. Close to duval street.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: mermaid60048
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient location, good inn , and a very pleasant place to stay. We liked it. We did check out the other Inns that make up this group and found that all of them seemed equally pleasant. Good deal fort he cost, quiet and picturesque. Would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Christelect
Reviews.Content: The staff was the best and the location was compared to none, away from the noise but close enough to go any where. Loved it and will come back real soon.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint renovated old house; don't expect modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ddenisem53
Reviews.Content: We started off on a not so great note. The room we were given was so small that to stay 3 days would have been uncomfortable. The manager found us another room that was big enough with a large wardrobe. The rooms had safes in them which is something we wanted, and free parking, a luxury in the tiny Duval Street area. We were able to walk from our room, and leisurely walk down to Mallory Square. The pool area was nice, secluded in the back of the houses. There were nice private decks off of each room. Complimentary continental breakfast was a nice touch. Yes, some of the rooms were small. It's a very old house, so don't expect modern but the furnishings were suited to your surroundings. I would say all in all, we would go there again if we go back to Key West, but would specify which rooms were acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: carolinewhite04
Reviews.Content: we prepaid for a king room, but when we saw it, it was to the side of the house, no outside space at all, (we saw a lot with) and very dark, it was day time and all the lamps were on. We asked if they had another room available, there was, it was in the front only a oueen room, but it had a great balcony to sit on. We took it, no offer of any refund. the shower room very small. shower tileing broken and coming off. floor and doors not as clean as they should be. no full lenght mirror, only bathroom mirror. Breakfast good, pool area good. walking distant to most things, and parking good. We stay at many historial inn in the US, they have been great places, we would return to all of them apart from this one ; sorry

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWV99
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea House looked good online, and in fact looked pretty good when we arrived. However, once we navigated the narrow hallways (our rolling luggage wouldn't fit through the hallway unless we turned it sideways) into our room, we realized our stay might not be what we expected. The room was "bare bones" to say the least. The bathroom door was a slatted closet door, and the hairdryer did not work well. There was no space in the bathroom to put toiletries (for a woman, this was very difficult). The entire place really needed some maintenance done. Breakfast was "continental", but they couldn't even keep the coffee area, bagel tray, and cereal basket full. The worst part was that we KILLED two giant cockroaches in our room. We even wrapped them up neatly and took them to the front desk. What did front desk do/say? Not a darn thing. No reaction. Don't stay at the Chelsea. There are a lot of nice places in Key West. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place and close to everything, but beware of booking through expedia.com”
Reviews.Author: Bellas79
Reviews.Content: Booked a queen room through expedia, and ended up with a full size bed in an attic room. Seeing how both of us were very tall, we knew that it would be too cramped for us. We asked the front desk guy why we weren't given a room with a queen sized bed, and he said that it is a common problem when booking through expedia. He uprgraded us to a king room that was available. The place was very nice, well maintained. Walking distance to everything. Would stay there again, but next time will book directly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Old World Patio Setting”
Reviews.Author: Gouvernail
Reviews.Content: Chelsea House is really a compound of cottage-styled homes (ca 1870s) similar to those found in and near the Garden District of New Orleans. The pool and patio areas are pleasantly designed with careful attention to trees and foliage. Located in the Old Town district it is a good walk to the tourist areas near Mallory Square. However, its neighborhood setting is charming, and easy walking distance to a number of good restaurants and nicer bars.The room we had was small and yet comfortable, almost like a ship's cabin--I knew that the lesser costing rooms were like this. The desk staff and others were courteous and interested in their guests' comfort. Outdoor breakfasts were most pleasant on the patio or decks. The off-street parking was a plus in this neighborhood as was the fact that the fine restaurant Seven Fish was a block away.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS A MAKE-OVER AND FAST.”
Reviews.Author: Cliff31
Reviews.Content: Although the B&B/hotel looks quite charming as a whole (and has friendly staff), a closer look reveals parts of it needs a desperate make-over, specifically the room we stayed in. The carpet was old (and scary!) and every time we entered the room, we had to endure a musty smell that only went away by airing the room out each time. The bathroom had chipped tile on the floor and old fixtures that housekeeping couldn't properly clean. (Although they did their best, I'm sure.) The rest of the experience included a mediocre, underwhelming breakfast (often out of basic items) and certainly no WOW factors anywhere. I wouldn't stay here again until they updated their rooms. And, until they do, they should adjust their rates. We found (and stayed at) a different B&B close by, offering much better everything - for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Suite for the price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Forgalicious
Reviews.Content: Loved it here. I would definitely stay again. We were warmly welcomed by the staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome, including holding out luggage until we could check in and even after we checked out. We got the suite and it was a great deal as far as Key West prices are concerned. It's just a couple blocks of an easy walk to Duval Street and not far from the Hemingway house and other tourist attractions. We walked everywhere and didn't need a car, and they do have free parking if you do have a car.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: scigme
Reviews.Content: After looking online for a place to stay for one night in Key West, my husband and I decided on the Chelsea House and we are so glad we did. At first we were considering Days Inn at $20 less, but when we factored in the price of buying breakfast and a cab ride to Duval street back and forth, we figured it made more sense to stay at the Chelsea House. Not only did we break even financially, we came out far better in many ways than we would have at the Days Inn. Here are all the positives: Chelsea House provided safe parking for our motorcycle on the brick pavement between their two buildings, Duval street is within walking distance, we had a nice continental breakfast by the pool in the morning, the building is historic and has true Key West character, we had a second floor room with a nice balcony where my husband could sit in a rocking chair, smoke a cigar and we could look out on Truman street. The real plus is that we booked a double bed (it was the best we could get for $149) but when we checked into our room, we had a huge king size bed with luxurious pillows and a large, clean room with balcony access. It was mid-week and they were slow, so they provided an upgrade free of charge. What a find! It made our one-night stay in Key West so comfortable and memorable. I highly recommend this hotel. The only negative is that there are roosters in Key West and some like to crow at 2:30 in the morning ( I guess they like to stay up and party late just like the people in KW do). These roosters roam around the town, so this is a problem you may find anywhere in KW, not just in the historic district, so my advice is to come prepared if you don't sleep well. I bought wax earplugs at CVS, stuffed those in my ears, so I muffled out any rooster racket, and I slept like a baby. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, not great.”
Reviews.Author: jbiel590
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at Chelsea House was OK, and I would give it a lukewarm recommendation as a suitable low-cost accommodation during the Key West high season. The good: We were greeted by Beth, who was very friendly and she was helpful with directions and advice on things to do. The pool was smallish but very nice, clean, and never crowded. The location was great; just far enough from Duval St. The OK: Overall the property seemed generally well cared for; our room could have used some updating but it was clean. The breakfast was sufficient; toast, bagels, muffins, cereal, juice, tea, and coffee. We would have like more fruit options, as they only had apples. It was served on the deck near the pool, which was nice. The bad: My wife and I spent four nights in a double room, which was tiny but adequate in that we were out of the room for the majority of the time; if rain had kept us inside, we may have been divorced by the storm's end due to the close quarters. I would check into larger rooms if I went back. We also found there was nowhere to put anything, particularly in the bath. The shower had no soap dish or shelves for shampoos, washclothes, and other items; we had to keep everything on the floor and keep bending over while inside in a very narrow shower stall. The sink was a pedestal sink which also had nowhere to put anything. There were also no hooks for all of our towels and wet bathing trunks. These sound like minor inconveniences but it became quite annoying, especially in such a tight area. Spending $20 on in-shower storage and some hooks on the wall and/or back of the door would be a vast improvement. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows felt like large pieces of foam. Definitely not the best night's sleep I've had. The bed had a wooden frame that stuck out much wider than the mattress and boxspring. I banged my leg on the frame more than once while moving around in the small room. Also, we were without toilet paper on out last day, as the room did not have the standard extra roll.

Reviews.Title: “Much better available for the price”
Reviews.Author: louie002
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money at all, just a good location, free parking and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointing rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ikin0ei
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a beautiful colonial house, garden was great, pool decent size, big car park, and quite central (2 blocks from Duval St, although quite a good walk from Mallory Square). But we were very disappointed in the room. Being there at Christmas we paid a very high price for a room as big as a cupboard, even though it was the "superior" double, supposedly bigger. I cannot imagine the standard double then...(it looked half the size of our room from the map of the hotel we got). We hardly had room to walk around the queen bed, no place to put our things, the bathroom was very tiny with no shelves at all, overall it was very standard, and any motel room would have been better. But mostly it had a terrible smell of dampness and mouldiness. The service was terrible, they were friendly at reception but apart from that we never saw anyone on the premises, the breakfast was nothing like on the video on the website, and it was prepared by a spanish speaking only staff that was happy to hide in the garden house rather than make sure everything was ok with guests. Overall it felt as if a group of investors had arranged the property to make the maximum profit out of it with the minimum effort. We understand Key West is expensive but that felt like rip off.

Reviews.Title: “over-priced but nice all the same”
Reviews.Author: avagabond52
Reviews.Content: Really liked the location and the style of this hotel and the heated pool was great first thing on an unseasonably chilly December morning. Breakfast was fine; self-service, plastic cutlery etc which seems to be commonplace in Florida but I think for the price of a clean but very average double room we might have expected something more. Tip: book on-line, it cost us a hundred dollars less than the quotation we got over the phone at the same time! However, it was great to stay in such a traditionally styled hotel which was far enough away from the centre to be quiet for sleeping but close enough to be able to go out and explore without having to move the car from the free car-park.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas get away”
Reviews.Author: PeteCHS
Reviews.Content: pros: -Great location-one block from Duval -own parking lot with lots available all the time -old colonial style house -free breakfast cons: -facilities are not kept up -room was outdated with cheap equipment. wallpaper came off the wall -heating did not work (45F outside) -OVERPRICED (270USD for a maybe 2 star hotel!!) -weird "concierge". They tell you they can help you with everything but if you have a concrete question they tell you to come back tomorrow or read the flyers/prospects) -breakfast is not exiting at all -room service did not change the sheets or vacuum although the carpet obvisouly needed some care. Its ok to sleep there especially because of the location and free parking (parking is a pain in the neck in downtown) but for this money I am sure there are better places. If the price would have been 100-150USD I would have recommended the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: cindycoholan
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel on line and expected quaint....what I got was rude and annoying. First I got a phone call one day before my reservation asking where we were....when I explained that we were checking in the following day the woman stated that she didnt have a room for that night and if she did it would be 200 more than promised. I told her I had the reservation and price on a printout and wanted what we had booked. She called me back hours later saying she could get us a room at the same price but had to downgrade us from a king to a queen...fair? I think not. But it was fantasy fest so we took the deal. Upon checking in we asked a nice young man at the front desk if anyone had canceled and if so could we be moved to a king. He, in fact, said they were not booked solid and right then the woman I had spoken with came out and said that was needed to stay with the queen and that they had done me a favor by finding a room. Really?? They were the ones that screwed up the reservation in the first place. Needless to say we stayed one night then went to the Truman hotel the next night. Much better hotel and at least the staff there were extremely helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ltwoody392
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel !!! Rooms were great and the location was perfect. Just a short walk from Duval St. and very quiet at night. Loved the morning breakfast poolside. We went down for a 4 day vacation with 30 friends and we will be back every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: joychuck
Reviews.Content: Chelsea House is within easy walking distance of Duval. The room we had was a decent size and on the 2nd floor (no elevator) but the bathroom was miniscule and the shower was horrible. Breakfast served every day was nice but nothing fantastic and was served around the pool. Pool area was nice. The front desk staff were great, especially Anetta. The staff hosted a stop for the participants of the Masquarade Parade with rum punch and chicken wings - did a great job. Would stay again but would ask for a room on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Kattapp
Reviews.Content: This location was fab yet, still quiet, clean and very comfortable. Thanks for a great , free breakfast bar every morning next to the beautiful swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Holadio
Reviews.Content: We went down to Key West for 2 days after having spent a few days at Miami Beach. My husband had been to the Chelsea Hotel 10 years ago and kept in good memory. But unfortunately within the last decade prices have gone up while the standard has most likely remained the same. That is: the room was ok, the king size bed was comfortable and all, but there was no minibar, the air condition was terribly noisy and in the bathroom there was no shelf for your stuff. Breakfast was included and arranged as buffet by the pool, charming idea, but the cutlery as well as cups and tiny plates were made out of plastic! The quality of the food was alright but forget fresh fruit apart from some floury apples, forget about cheese and cold meat. Still, the hotel has its charme and run down atmosphere but 200 Dollars for a night is way too expensive. It's a pity that nobody seems to care more than necessary about the historic key west inns.

Reviews.Title: “Right Where I Wanted To Be”
Reviews.Author: mrnohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over race weekend. The hotel is older (it was a house 100 years ago) but updated. Your going to carry your luggage up the stairs, you may hear some traffic (run the AC it blocks it out) but it is a small price to pay for a cool place that's just a few blocks from everything. It's very clean For the money...we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: OKTraveler77
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something within walking distance of all the action, this is it! The hotel sits on Truman which is a busy street. Our room was directly over the front desk/check-in area. It had a door opening to a shared balcony overlooking Truman street. The traffic noise could be a little loud, but I was happy to find out that we didn't ever hear any noise from the hallway or the adjoining rooms. It was also nice to sit out on the balcony (there are two big chairs for each room out there) in the morning. The room itself had a weird furniture layout. The bed was right there as you walked in the door. But it left for more room around the door to the balcony. We also had a small refrigerator in our room and a flat-screen TV attached to the wall. Our bathroom was quite small also, but it was functional. One bad thing: the carpet seemed sticky. We had breakfast one morning. It is very basic. Lots of pastries, bagels and breads, yogurt, apples, coffee and juice. But there are plenty of amazing breakfast places in Key West. The staff was always very helpful with tons of suggestions and coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely laidback hotel, walking distance from Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: LeprechaunConnemara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four days and had a lovely time here. We could walk to most sights, from the hotel it's only a five minute walk to Duval Street. Breakfast was basic but very nice, served by the pool. We had our own private deck with the room. The pool and gardens were lovely. If I could give one suggestion for improvement, it would be to serve breakfast on ceramic or even paper plates and with reusable cutlery so I wouldn't have felt guilty every morning about throwing away all that plastic. All in all a lovely place to stay, I would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay & nice place”
Reviews.Author: lexus873
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed during August in 2009 for the weekend. The location was near many of the sights of Key West. Our room and bathroom was large. Don't plug to many appliances in at one time in the bathroom. My fiance tripped the breaker to the room from her blow dryer. Breakfast is provided in the mornings which is cereal, toast, muffins, coffee, and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: galen1996
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday, October 22 for a 2 night stay. We paid $160/night including all taxes and requested a standard room. While the room was neat and clean, it was the tiniest room we had ever seen and directly on the pool. It was the end unit on the south side so we had an additional window - unfortunately... There are three lights just outside that window, including one you could land an airplane by. I'm a light sleeper so that bothered me. When we arrived home after dinner on Saturday we had no water, so we were moved (at 10 pm and exhausted) to another room in the main house. This was an upgrade as there were no other rooms, with a king bed instead of queen, a much larger and nicer room. Wish we had been there the night before. The staff were very nice and willing to store our bags for a few hours on Sunday since we were leaving late afternoon. Breakfast was basic, but adequate, and the coffee is good - major point with us! The location is great, just a couple of blocks off Duval and easy walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at chelsea house pool and gardens was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: bill41048
Reviews.Content: service was excellent. Staff was pleasant and courteous. Breakfast was in the pool area which was peaceful and relaxing. Breakfast was good except for extra strong coffee on the second day. Great location on Truman Ave, only 2 blocks from Duval Street and another 5 to 6 blocks from Mallory Square and Sunset Pier. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep i've had all year.”
Reviews.Author: spiike14
Reviews.Content: If your going to Key West, staying at the Chesea House is a must. The King room has the most comfortable bed i've slept on other than my own at home. I finally got a full nights sleep without waking up once in many months. My friends said the same about the queen rooms. Service was great. This was the second time i've stayed there and i'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vickie83
Reviews.Content: We got here at 11pm after a 12 hour bus journey and we couldn't have been happier! The room was clean and comfortable, we loved the pool and the continental breakfast was lovely. Great location, would definately go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Awesome staff and my great dane liked it too.”
Reviews.Author: turfbill
Reviews.Content: Nice B&B. Pool area / Braekfast area real nice and comfortable. The A/C broke in our room, after we checked in and ran around Key West we relized something was not right. I called the front desk, it was after 8. I expected to have someone fix it in the morning. They moved us right then, to a cold room upfront with a porch. The room was just a tad smaller put nice private entrance and easy access. Great time was had... OH yeah the great dane. Key West was not pet freindly due to a incident there some months back. Only a few shops let us in and NO eateries with Dana (great dane). Still had relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy but nice”
Reviews.Author: SunLover2938
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Chesea House by one of their partners because of the sun deck. We had a King Ensuite, #31. Two rooms with heart pine floors. Comfortable bed, clean room with fridge large enough for our drinks and refreshments. The tv was not viewable from the bed but that wasn't a big deal for us. The bathroom shower was roomy, but you could sit on the commode and brush your teeth. The breakfast is not served until 8:30, a pain for early risers. Good Coffee!!!! Excellent restaurants in easy walking distance. WiFi available around the pool area. We would recommend to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Key West”
Reviews.Author: gbrumley
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at Chelsea House. Staff was very friendly and most accomodating. Had to stay on the 3rd floor the first night but was upgraded to the first floor (larger room) the second night. This was done by the front desk without our request. The rooms were very clean.There was no noise at night and little traffic. The pool was nicely shaded with all sorts of tropical trees and plants. We had ample parking, not having to drive anywhere we went. Short walking distance to Duvall Street and great restaurants. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean with great locatiom”
Reviews.Author: TonyGA
Reviews.Content: I booked queen DLX. I was upgrated to King DLX. No coffee maker in the room. Breakfast served way to late. I never saw the Breakfast, so no comment on that. Staff is nice and helpful. Tried to check in at 2pm room wasn't ready. Went walking in town they called around 4pm said room was ready. Check in quick and easy. Check out same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Christa123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 6 days and had a good time, the rooms are a little small, but very clean. The staff was super. The Inn is within walking distance to Duval Street, we did not use our rent car the entire time. I agree, the breakfast could have been served a little earlier than 8:30am.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!!”
Reviews.Author: HowIseeit
Reviews.Content: Found this wonderful hotel in the AAA book and booked our room the day before - sight unseen. What a wonderful surprise. Gorgeously decorated, high ceilings and a brand new beautiful bathroom. Very quiet at night. Comfortable beds. Our room was right next to the pool. This location is so close to Duval Street - it's wonderful. We parked and never used the car again. The breakfast buffet had something for everyone. My only concern is personal as I am a nutritionist and I would have preferred a little more healthy options at the breakfast - possibly more fruit choices or low-fat/calorie items but that is my hang-up not most people's. So a big recommendation for these accomadations. We got a very reasonable rate (as it was off season) although I realize that the room would have cost a lot more during high season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Chelsea House!”
Reviews.Author: charts
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid May and again over the 4th of July weekend. Property consists of 3 houses side by side. About 30 rooms in total. In May, I stayed in a very small room on the 3rd floor of the main building. It was very clean and quiet with private porch but alot of steps to climb. For the 4th, I stayed in Rm.#33A. Big bedroom with living room sofa and flat panel TV, private porch. The bed was fantastic. Would definitely ask for this room again. Front desk was very nice and helpful. Key West News provided every day. Pool is nice and clean. Breakfast is average, but very good OJ and coffee. Lots of free parking, but you really don't need a car to get around. 2 blocks from Duval. For the money, about $150/ night including taxes this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The hallways of the old house house are...”
Reviews.Author: Kevobooker
Reviews.Content: The hallways of the old house house are not air conditioned. My stay was unfortunately up several stairs to the top floor. The property itself is shady and appealing. The pool is smaller than it appears in pics n video but was a nice gathering area for everyone. One ice machine by the pool for the whole place. The room was tiny and there were ants or termites all over the dresser. There was only a stand up shower with minimal water pressure. However, it's only two blocks from Duval St. I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Chelsea House is wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: generica101
Reviews.Content: After a horrific trip from DC to Key West, my gentleman friend and I were exhausted, very cranky, and totally ready to check into our room and get a cocktail. The front desk person, Bill, was so friendly, informative, and funny - he made us feel better right off the bat. After hooking us up with drink tickets at various locations, we went to our room to drop off our bags and were blown away. The photos of the rooms on the website don't capture their personality. We had a private porch, a great view, the room was nice and cool, and the bed was unbelievably comfortable. The service was great, the room was fabulous, the location was convenient. Thank you Chelsea House! You turned our trip around!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: okeefenokee
Reviews.Content: staff is excellent, great location, off street parking is a real plus, rooms are clean and all have character, breakfast is a treat especially coffee

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Dpvid
Reviews.Content: Key West is an expensive place. Given Key West prices, this hotel seemed reasonably priced. My five-star rating takes into account this value for the price. Obviously, this isn't a fancy chain hotel, so if that's what you seek, you might want to look elsewhere. This hotel is in a pleasant location within walking distance of many restaurants. The hotel itself is older, but the room for two and the bed were fine. The staff was pleasant. The breakfast wasn't that great, but hey, it was free. And there's the free parking lot, which you will definitely appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to that hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucrecia48
Reviews.Content: The personnel are not friendly, actually they are very rude, specially the manager Chuck he is so arrogant and treat me like I have never being treated before, scream at me and my daughter inlaw I don't know what was his problem but certanlly you never treat a guest like that . I suggest to him that the shower was not as expected for a room of $200.00 a night, and that the housekeeper never knocks the door, just comes in. It was a nightmare and ruined our weekend.That is my opinion and my veiw.

Reviews.Title: “We could never been so mistreated by management and staff - A legit nightmare !”
Reviews.Author: allynepascoal
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Key West this weekend (Memorial Day) was planned to celebrate my mother-in-law 62nd birthday. We arrived on Saturday 05/29 before 12pm and we were quite well taken care of at check-in, except that we booked online so the check in time that was printed in our confirmation reflected 03pm and the check out at 12pm (we have the vouchers to confirm this information). We got to the "Chelsea House" a little before 12pm and the rooms we not ready. Sylvia, my mother-in-law, got mixed up thinking that the check in was at 12pm and check out at 03pm. The reception desk assistant/clerk/officer/operator Kathy (I want to make sure I don't offend anyone) was gladly outspoken to make my mother-in-law feel bad and understand that she was "really" mistaken. Sylvia asked Kathy is she spoke Spanish by any chance as she had a strong accent, maybe British? Kathy responded no, just English. You can imagine, Sylvia is native from Guatemala and her English is just about fair. It was really a silly mistake but even at that moment we WERE NOT advised that the check out time was changed from 12pm to 11am. Kathy was not very happy with the misunderstanding and was not happy with us. We signed the credit card slips and got the keys. Only after we left the hotel on Monday 05/31 that we've noticed in small letters in the bottom of the page, the check out time change. When we signed the credit card slips, the 11am time was never mentioned. We (the 3 of us) were all under the impression that the check out time was at 12pm. We even planned out the last day 05/31 around that time. Kathy got my cell phone number and in fact she called at 02:30pm and left a message on my cell phone advising that the rooms were ready. We came back to the Chelsea House around 4pm and we then brought our luggage upstairs, lots of stairs. Our room was very small. The dark blue carpet in front of our bathroom was wet, not sure if from previous guests or a water leak. We never complained. Days went by and on Monday 05/31 (check out day) we got prepared to leave the Hotel at 12pm. We never received a check out call or reminder. In fact my husband visited the front desk that morning and spoke to Bill requesting a late check out, which was denied. Again the 11am time was not mentioned. At and around 11:40am the housekeeper entered my room WITHOUT knocking which was not the proper way of entering a guest's room. You can check any Hotel operating policy. She got very scared and my small dog barked at her (yes, itâ€™s a pet's friendly hotel, few rooms only). I was in the bathroom and didn't even have the chance to apologize. She closed the door and left. Right after that, she entered my mother-in-law's room WITHOUT knocking once again. Sylvia (mother-in-law) was in fact naked in the bathroom. What kind of privacy this hotel offers? The nightmare starts now: after 15 minutes of this incident, "Chuck" the manager, was standing outside Sylvia's room knocking again, minding you that the hotel had the "vacancy" red sign hanging outside. I walk right behind him and informed that we were taking the luggage down (lots of stairs, no elevator) to complete the check out (still under the impression that was at 12pm). When we finally go to the reception, some other guests were doing the check out so we sat outside at the balcony not to disturb. "Chuck" came around and said with a weird attitude that we could go in "right after" the other guests were done with their check out. We felt that our presence there was really bothering him.
