So, the other guests left and we walked in. "Chuck" directed us to speak to Bill, so we though he was out of the picture. He in fact sat on his chair and watched us. When I was returning my key, Sylvia went to speak to him to inform/complain about the housekeeper entering her room without calling or knocking. Unfortunately my mother-in-law used the term "maid" instead of "housekeeper" which by no means had a derogatory meaning and is a common word used in Central America for cleaning ladies. Again, she is not fluent in English. "Chuck" overreacted and started screaming at us, with a level "10" arrogance. He stated that "he was glad to be in America where you can speak your opinions". To the Hotel guests ???? I don't think so. What kind of behavior is that ? We were insulted, mistreated and felt very bad. That ruined our trip all together and my poor mother-in-law felt terrible at her own birthday weekend. She didnâ€™t mean to offend anyone. She just wanted to make a suggestion/complaint and to inform that the shower head was blocked and the water was not running through it very well. "Chuck" advised us to get a room at the HYATT for 400.00 a night instead of staying with them again. Also that they didn't need guest "like us". What an insult. To top it of, I mentioned to Bill that we were not leaving Key West till down and that we would be back with the second key we got at check in. Again, "Chuck" shouted out loud that I would have to pay $20.00 for the missing key. Did he think I was lying? That I wanted to keep an extra key of a room that I would never visit again? Not in this life time anyway. So we did, we came back around 04:30pm, we dropped off the extra key and we finalized arrangements for the bicycles pick-up next morning which worked well with the bicycle staff, but of course, we had to swallow "Chuck" unfortunate comment that they were not on the bicycle business and that they would not do us any favors. WHAT A NIGHTMARE! ! ! So, if you want to be mistreated by "Chuck" (the manager) come and stay at THE CHELSEA HOUSE, I feel bad for the guest, staff members and the owner of this place who probably is unaware of the manager he has in place. The Sanchez family.

Reviews.Title: “Good for this trip, will try another next.....”
Reviews.Author: dolcevitaBoston
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review; "It does the job." We stayed in #18, which is pet friendly. We were happy to find this place thanks to this site :) I always appreciate pet friendly lodging. I like the location. Loved the free parking-bonus! The staff was helpful. Pool was nice to come back to after a long day's sightseeing.The room was clean enough, but still had a funky, somewhat musty feel to it. The bedspread and blanket I removed immediately. The bathroom consisted of a toilet and a shower stall. Very small space. I hit my head twice while trying to get up from the toilet, due to the size of the space. TMI ...right? The vanity was in the bedroom next to the bed. Breakfast was just average: coffee, juice, yogurt, cereal and breads, bananas and oranges. No cut fruit . The only warm items would be if you toasted the bread. All in all a good choice, but will try someplace else next time. Loved Key West, BTW.

Reviews.Title: “DOES THE JOB”
Reviews.Author: JerryDEBO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nites. The company owns/operates 5 of these type of places. This one consists of 4 restored houses with free off street parking and a small pool. BE AWARE- the rooms are all different and vary in size and the airconditioner is the thru the wall type (that in our room was way op the wall so getting it adjusted took us a day or so. Also the pool is smaller than it looks on the web site. Location is good- from what I have seen of the beaches & waterfronts I would not spend the big bucks for those hotels plus most charge p[arking fees and resort fees a rip off. Here the parking is free and there is no resort fee- The included breakfast does the job and the pool allows for a refresshing dip after a day of touring. There is no bar or resturant but there are many many in Key West so have no fear. Rooms and decor are nice and clean- Staff is helpful- I am not sure about value since there are many places like this one- DEBENEDETTETRAVEL

Reviews.Title: “This Charming Historic Inn saved our trip to Key West...”
Reviews.Author: TRACINJW
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our stay with BONE ISLAND VACATION RENTALS. To make a long story short, they said they were dog friendly, but upon arriving, they were not friendly to OUR DOGS. So we drove around trying to find alternate accommodations. We found Chelsea House, and they saved our trip. Not only were they pet friendly, they gave us a large room with a private wrap around porch so our dogs could sit outside with us. The room was large, clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly but not intrusive. CHELSEA HOUSE WAS FANTASTIC AND I AM ALREADY LOOKING FORWARD TO OUR NEXT STAY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: 34345Sunlover
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed at the Chelsea House. It was very relaxing, pleasant stay again. The staff is friendly and helpful, the location and the parking is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “You could find much better for less”
Reviews.Author: Keyscritter93
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in the Light House Inn when I'm in Key West, but it was sold out this time. They recommended this sister property, also part of the historic inn's of Key West. The rooms were sparse with no hanging storage(no real problem if you are only staying a few nights) The bed was very comfortable but that was about it for the room. Breakfast is complementary, but not worth it. The only thing fresh was the coffee. Go to the Six Toed Cat or Blue Heaven instead. One interesting this happened during our stay. The fire alarm went off. The fire department arrived with two units! The hotel staff had no plan what so ever and provided zero information to the guests. Not even a "sorry for the inconvenience" when we checked out. Just as well it was a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute at Chelsea House”
Reviews.Author: gringo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chelsea House B&B from April 27 to May 2nd and loved every minute of this wonderful Colonial B&B Inn. This was my first time to Key West and was very impressed with our accomodations as it was very quaint and in such a quiet residential location close to Duvall Street. First off our check-in was a breeze and the free parking was bonus as we had driven the scenic drive down from Miami through the Keys.We walked everywhere during our stay being so close to Duvall Street and all the fun restaurants,bars and great music (It was The Songwriters Festival from April 28-May 2nd so we were very fortunate to be there to enjoy all the talented musicians). We were given one of the beautiful ground floor Suites which I cannot compare to any others as I did not see them but I just loved it.I was told it was the best suite in the B&B and we were very happy to have such a comfortable,private Suite with a large porch and two concrete picnic tables in front that had umbrellas to shade us while we would sit,eat and have a cocktail or two. You can also get Wi-Fi at the concrete tables instead of around the pool if needed. We had 2 French Doors in our Suite that would open up so we could have a nice breeze through the room.The doors were from our sitting area and also from our bedroom out to the large porch. It was also very nice having a fridge in the room to keep our water,beer and whatever else we needed to keep cold. The A/C worked wonderfully along with the ceiling fans in the sitting room and above the king sized bed. I had read some reviews that the beds were not very comfortable and the sheets needed upgrading,WRONG!!!! Well all I can say is it was luxurious to me with the bed being firm but plush which I love and the sheets and pillows were very good quality. One thing I knew about before was that the bathroom was going to be on the small side and there was no counter or storage space so I just brought a little basket to put all my toilettries in and set it on the back of the toilet tank,you just have to be inventive and voilet organized! Our room was steps away from the pool where there is an ice machine and ice water dispenser.In the morning it was so handy to walk out from our room and grab the Continental Breakfast consisting of great hot coffee,O.J,muffins,bagels,toast (toaster provided) yoghurt and fresh fruit.I just loved that we could sit on our porch and enjoy coffee,muffins etc without having to rush around to find a restaurant as I truly enjoy the laid back mornings listening to the birds and looking around the tropical vegetation on the property. The pool was small but a welcome Oasis when the temperatures and humidity were high.The one day we did want to sit poolside it was a little crowded so we went upstair to the Adults Only "CLOTHING OPTIONAL DECK" where we were the only ones up there and I could fill in some of my bikini top tan lines,ha! All in all we fully enjoyed Chelsea House B& B and would go back in a heartbeat to enjoy all that Key West has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “met all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: kempyy
Reviews.Content: fantastic colonial buildings very well preserved and expertly updated with luxury accomodation and tranquil surroundings. you wn"t be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Oasis in busy Key West”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler21
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast was a real find! We stayed for two days and were sorry to leave. The location was fantastic--an easy walk to downtown, yet in a quiet neighborhood. The staff was warm and friendly, very helpful in recommending restaurants and other attractions. Our rooms were fine, with clean, recently renovated bathrooms and very comfortble beds. The Chelsea House grounds are just beautiful, with a courtyard pool, brick walkways, and lush plantings of palm and other plants. A very nice continental breakfast is served in the courtyard. No, it's not the Marriott, but for a close-in small hotel with real personality and Key West ambiance, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, not great, just OK.”
Reviews.Author: imitation-of-mink
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip to Key West and also decided not to pay the Marquesa's prices this time. Chose Chelsea House based on tripadvisor reviews. It's just OK, nothing to write home about. The house we're in was built in 1891, so don't expect new anything. The rooms are clean and our bathroom appears to be recently remodeled. There seems to be no one here; although, the front desk clerk says they have a full house. The pool is usually pretty empty and quiet. Our room was the Forster room #26 which faced busy Truman. Noise was not a problem; although, I did hear a few large delivery trucks rumble past during the night. There's a window unit a/c which prettty much drowns out any street noise. Staff: they just ignore everyone. I mean, the only person who even made eye contact or spoke to us was the pool maintenance guy. Check in was efficient and quick. The place appears to need about a million dollars worth of renovation and TLC -- lots of peeling paint and warped decking. I realize the elements of nature here are relentless, but this place could use a thorough remodel and update. Wireless internet connection only works in the pool area. The good news is, we found some other places for the same rate or maybe just a few dollars more that look much better: try the brand new Truman Hotel or the Orchid Key Inn for a more up-to-date experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good for children.”
Reviews.Author: jazger
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Chelsea House. It's location was great (near the quieter part of Duvall Street, a Laundromat, Hemmingway House, the cemetary.) It has a nice pool, which is a great place to get away. The breakfast is not great, and the floors of our room were not very clean, and it would have been nice to have a chair or a desk in the room. But the staff were kind, and responsive, and the setting is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Boarding House”
Reviews.Author: tennistraveler12
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews about Chelsea House, I thought I would try this bed and breakfast inn in Key West. What a disapointment! My room was very dated and the carpet was ripped along the wall. Paint was peeling from the walls and there is an old fashioned window air conditioner positioned right above the bed. The bedding was in desperate need of updating. But, on a brighter note - there were no signs of bed bug or other bugs, so that was a huge relief! Breakfast was pitiful. Frozen factory made mini muffins and bagels were put out to thaw for the 8:30am crowd. There were also sorry looking danishes and some yogurt for the taking as well. Coffee was probably the best thing on the continental breakfast buffet line. For $200 and some change, one would expect a decent room with a few upgraded amenities. This is not so with Chelsea House - it was clearly obvious that they cut corners every where they could. One positive plus - walking distance to Duval Street

Reviews.Title: “Will return for sure”
Reviews.Author: sanarysurmer
Reviews.Content: My son, nice and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Chelsea House. We loved the rooms and the atmosphere, but best of all the service Kathy provided. Key West has plenty of bed and breakfast places, but the service at the Chelsea House sets it apart from many of the others. Kathy is a gem and gets an A plus for customer service. The location of this facility is superb. Once you arrive you can park your car and walk wherever you want to go, a plus in Key West. I will return for sure and recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: newadventure2
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. Really enjoyed the fact that we could just park the car and walk 2 blocks to Duval Street. The corner of Duval and Truman is also a trolley stop which was convenient. This is the first time I've stayed in a house converted to hotel and I thoroughly enjoyed it. However, if you are expecting a 'chain hotel' atmosphere, you probably won't like it here.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: WarmthSeekerChicago
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews, we chose to stay here due to the location in Key West. We have always enjoyed the boutique/bed & breakfast type hotels. The location was excellent along with the staff. We stayed in one of the junior suites and were surprised at the cleaning of the room including any used dishes everyday. As for any street noise - coming from Chicago it was a nonissue. It added to the ambiance of the Keys. The trip would have been excellent if the weather had cooperated but we found ourselves bundling up and enjoying any moment of sun. We would highly recommend the Dry Tortutgus excursion - hang onto your hat - it was a wild windy day and half the ship was sick off the back! They warn you!! We never did get to try out the pool but found the gardens and pool very inviting. The continental breakfast is what it is proposed to be. Northing fancy but very fresh. Our only complaint was the weather!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Nico42841
Reviews.Content: Very charming guest house, quiet, good service. Perfectly located in Key West downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great B and B”
Reviews.Author: Jnate1701
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea House was just great. The room was large and clean. Breakfast was more than ample and the service was perfect. We liked the location - parked our car and didn't use it again till we left. We enjoyed staying in an historic home and will stay there again for our next visit to Key West. Recommended to my brother who booked a room this week.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again- poor value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sandsadie
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews before booking we were very disappointed with this facility. Our room was in an annex and was rather shabby with battered furniture and very small bathroom with no storage space. We even had to move a night stand in order to open the closet door. Had to go out on a dimly lit porch or to a room in another building to get internet service. Breakfast was especially poor with a few frozen pastries and stale cereal- we didn't even try it after the first day. Eating by the pool in Jan. was not that pleasant as the surroundings seemed unkempt. The man at the front desk was pleasant and helpful and the location was convenient but we would never go back. Rates are much too high for this room and we felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Amber64
Reviews.Content: Good immediately at start with very friendly and cooperative check in. Room was not in the best possible position, if possible ask for something facing towards the pool and underline when booking. The room was may be smaller that a normal King Side bed but the feeling we've got when entering was of a recent remodeling place. Extremely clean, nice bathroom. Walking distance from main street, Duval Street. Nice the breakfast at the pool in the morning. Pool, is small but clean and we enjoied a nice swim immediately after we arrived late in the evening. Clear and heated water. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice historic mansion with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Marky68us
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for this historic mansion (not too close to Duval st) . Front desk staff was exquisite especially a young guy who very kindly made all arrangements for us (new year's eve show and dinner, sea sailing cruise...). A very good seafood restaurant is just about 250 m from the hotel ! To be improved: breakfast is a bit wanting although eating by the pool is great. it was difficult to block out the light at night as there were no curtains all the way up the front door and outside lights were ever switched off. However bathroom was very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Romantic, Historical”
Reviews.Author: daverrco
Reviews.Content: This historical b & b is located three blocks from Duval Street. The front desk clerk was very pleasant and efficient. We stayed in a room with a king sized bed and a sitting room with a nice flat-screen TV. The bathroom was a bit small, but this did not detract from our enjoyment of the room and its overall quaintness. There is a swimming pool and a satisfying continental breakfast is served each morning at poolside. This is a nice, romantic bed and breakfast. :And as an added bonus, a friendly cat roams the grounds to greet guests.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice room, good price”
Reviews.Author: glorbegozo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the chelsea house for two day and loved it. great location, quiet and a wonderful value. we got the deluxe room with the king size bed. very comfortable and it came with a very sweet pet cat. we would stay there again. the only improvement could be a jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice setting, too expensive for value”
Reviews.Author: globtrotter4ever
Reviews.Content: not far from Duval main street, rent comes with parking, rooms are basic, downturn is small bathroom, old and poor beds, very disappointing breakfast, nice backyard with swimming pool. Overall not worth the money we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The Chelsea House is an adorable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JamB57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our one night at the Chelsea House on October 26, 2009. My husband and I had traveled to Key West for a short trip away from Minnesota before winter brought snow and cold weather. We only stayed at the Chelsea house one night when we couldn't cancel our other hotel reservation that was farther away from Duval. The service at check-in was great and our room was ready at the time that it was supposed to be. We were in the Butterfly Room on the second level. The room was spacious and comfortable. The shower was a little small and wasn't someplace you wanted to spend a lot of time in - get in and get out, but the bathroom did the trick. The pool was small, but small in a cute way. The breakfast was also very good and hit the spot after a night out of drinking on Duval. Will consider staying here again on our next trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddyroks
Reviews.Content: Just wasn't up to par. Someone different at the front desk every time you called or stopped by, seemed that no one really knew what was going on. The railings on the balcony of our second floor room were rotted and falling out. Tree branches were growing over one side of our balcony. The bed was not level so your feet were higher than your head and and you rolled to one side. There was what appeared to be pet hair all over the carpet. This was supposed to be a free upgrade to one of their better suites, I would hate to see what it would be without the upgrade. Wifi does not work in the room that we were in.

Reviews.Title: “A place to feel special as long as you need and want to!”
Reviews.Author: Seaweed_Sister
Reviews.Content: We both loved the luxury of the room, the large space and lovely old - fashioned feel of another time, and lived in the pool. The little breakfast area and pool were perfect for both sun and shade and the privacy factor in the house and pool were very important to us. Easy access to everything and nice to return to after a day in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home while in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Muse54
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Chelsea House for I week in Key West. Renting bikes( Eaton Street Bikes) was the way to go. They dropped off the bikes and picked them up at the Chelsea House. The staff helped with all our arrangements, snorkeling, dining, transportation etc. Don't miss cafe con leche at Sonnys Deli 2 blocks away. All of Duval Street is within walking Distance, that is where we went at night. Best beach is Fort Zachary Taylor Beach. There is a minimal charge but well worth it Food, restrooms, snorkel gear rental available

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: NikM13
Reviews.Content: Went here upon recommendation of friends. Got a great deal during the summer season. We were able to bring our dog which was fantastic. We had a small room but did not feel cramped. It was very clean. Did not wake up for breakfast so can't comment on that. Love the quiet pool area - so relaxing and laid back! Hope to go back again and I recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B that's pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: JamieLeighB
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here for 1 yr anniversary. Pet friendly so we could take our doggy :)

Reviews.Title: “Poky rooms, rude staff and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LondonJohn1971
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location this place has nothing going for it. The staff are amongst the worst I have come across in the United States - rude, incompetent and poorly trained. We were supposed to stay for 4 nights but left after 2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cozy Victorian Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dounda_19
Reviews.Content: Beautifull, Cozy hotel located just two blocks from Duval Street. Perfect for pockets!

Reviews.Title: “We'll go somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Tootchmcgootch
Reviews.Content: From previous reviews, I believe it highly depends on the room you stay in as to whether it makes or breaks your stay at this B&B. I was traveling on business and then booked an extra day for leisure. We were assigned room 6 in the main house. When we booked the trip we took the more expensive rate ($30 more/day) for access to a refrigerator-we definitely paid this frig off in 3 days-bring a cooler.. I was told the room was recently renovated. The bathroom was renovated - and the room might have been repainted. The rug was horrible. The room was depressing. We could have been anywhere USA - in some old house. I would call and ask about the room ahead of time. I tried to do this - but could not get through - after dialing numerous times, the phone would just cut off.

Reviews.Title: “Key west wedding”
Reviews.Author: debgeoff
Reviews.Content: We spent a great time in the Keys, and what added to our time was the wonderful room we had at the Chelsea House. The staff was very responsive and attentive to our needs. The location is prime to all areas of the final key and we just can't say enough about how wonderful the place was. We went to a wedding at the Light House Point Inn and the setting there was so tropical and romantic. We will absolutely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The musty smell hits you in the face when you open the door.”
Reviews.Author: beckfordm
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is the second time I have stayed at the Chelsea House. I returned with friends because my first stay was amazing. I must have stayed in the best room in the place on that trip (and it was even the dog room - the only room you're allowed to have an animal). This trip and room was a completely different story. The service was great. Front office lady was friendly and we had fresh towels each day. The bed was straightened each day as well. The pool was also great. The temperature was perfect and we had fun. However, the room was not so great. The bed was worse than sleeping on the floor. The room smelled like wet wood. The musty odor hit you in the face when the door opened. We had asked about a different room upon arrival (just one with two beds) and the lady stated that they were completely booked. So we didn't bother going back after we smelled the room. I found it odd though that the vacancy sign stayed up the whole time we were there. Nothing in the room dried - not bathing suits, not towels, and not even our hair. It was just damp in there. Upon checkout, we mentioned the smell in the room and asked if anyone had ever complained before and she stated no, but she would let someone know. Not sure if that will ever happen. I feel so bad because I recommended this place to my friends, and they had a bad room too. I won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: tscteach03
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to get to Chelsea House based on some of the reviews from Trip Advisor and the Chelsea House website. Let me preface this by saying my husband and I really enjoy small B & Bs. This was too big for us. However, that is not the reason I gave it the ratings I gave. The bed was horrendous. We might as well have slept on cardboard. The room had a musty odor to it and so did the room of some friends of ours down the hall. The pool was ample and we did have fun there. We did receive fresh towels on the second day and our room had been tidied up. The hotel is close to Duval Street. When we mentioned the odor and the bed issues the front desk said they would "make a note of it." I guess this just wasn't what we thought it was going to be and we were dissapointed in the money we had spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but once is enough”
Reviews.Author: Joy82
Reviews.Content: We picked the Chelsea House for it's location and value. The Chelsea House is ok i guess, it has a nice pool. There aren't any "gardens" as their name states. I asked about this and the guy said there were no gardens just the landscaping surounding the place (which was very unkept). The bathroom was covered with ants. The blanket on the bed had dozens of cigarette holes in it and the bed spread had stains on it that would probably come out if only washed. The rest of the room was fine. There wasn't a clean place to eat the continental breakfast each morning and my husband had to ask for a rag to clean off tables and chairs to sit at as they were all covered with things from the trees and dew. On the positive side, the pool was very nice and a great temperature. One gal working the office suggested a local italian restaurant which was wonderful, best meal we had in the keys! This was our first time in a bed and breakfast, not what I was expecting, not quaint like, more like a hotel wanna be. We would not stay here again but others who were there loved it and it was their return trip. If I'm going to have hotel like accomodations, give me the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Bouthique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ximenahc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 10th aniversary at Miami and decided to go to Key West for the weekend, we drived around the place and found Chelsea House, as soon as i saw it i knew i wanted to stay there, I loved the house, the location, the name..and the best was yet to come. Our room was just remodeled, it was the most beautiful room I have ever seen, I felt like in Pottery Barn catalog, with a super modern flat TV, a brand new bathroom, a balcony right in the corner, wine and beverage keeper in the night table... everything perfect, it is just 2 blocks away from Hemingways house, and right in the center of the old town, with nice streets to walk by and stop. A very nice breakfast by the pool is included, the front porsche with rocking chairs is lovely and the place is peacefully quiet. Chelsea House is more a Boutique Hotel rather than a Bed & Breakfast. Age: 38 years old Citizenship: Peruvian Profession: Architect

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint”
Reviews.Author: lbeezer
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed last week and while the weather was a little cool, by the pool in the afternoon it was wonderful. We met wonderful people from all over and had great conversation at the pool area. We had a very nice room with a living area. The staff was very nice and very cordial. Our room could have used a "little extra dusting and care" but we over all we felt comfortable and compared it to staying at a friends home.. No complaints. Our only problem and obviously no fault of the Inn was that it was Bikers Week, still no problem, but being on Truman St., it is busy and was quite loud ALL night long.

Reviews.Title: “Good intro to Key West...”
Reviews.Author: skyJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chelsea the second week of January; the check-in was courteous, and the location suited us perfectly. The room we initially booked was small, but not unreasonably so in an old building; in the morning, we asked for a room in which we could open the window, rather than run the A/C (January, remember?), and they moved us to a much larger room at no extra cost. All during our stay the staff were friendly and competent; folks went out of their way to be nice. The bathroom in the older building had an original-style old tile floor, period fixtures, lots of charm; the newer building has modern plumbing but less detail. Both rooms had comfortable beds. The pool is excellent, but not clothing optional, which we had expected (from other sources). The pool area is also the breakfast area; breakfast is minimal by our B&B standards - yogurt, bagels, juice & coffee, nothing cooked. We walked from Chelsea to Mallory Square, to Hemingway's house, to the southernmost marker, and all along Duval St. Of course the same could be said for anywhere in Key West proper - it isn't that big a place. Bike rental nearby, CVS a block away, great little seafood restaurant in the next block on Elizabeth. Easily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Jinglz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights--from Feb 9th to the 11th. We had a nice time. This is an old inn--but well kept , relatively quiet, and has a nice historic feel to it. The staff is helpful, the location is good--just a short walk to most things you might like--including bike rentals and Duval Street. Our room was fairly small, but we managed to make it work out. They include a fairly basic, but decent continental breakfast each morning. The pool is small, but clean. The price was reasonable--keeping in mind that there are no bargains in Key West. We would look forward to staying here again. It is a very comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little place”
Reviews.Author: LiveInOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a long weekend trip down to Key West and stayed at Chelsea House. We stayed in lucky number 13. It was the cutest little room. We had reserved a room with a full size bed, but were upgraded to a queen, which was nice since we have a dog who likes to sleep in the bed (it's a dog friendly inn). And the bed was comfortable. The grounds were nice with little walkways between the buildings. It's in a great location, within walking distance to Southernmost Point, Duval St., Mallory Square. The man and woman at the front desk were friendly and check in was smooth. We loved our stay at Chelsea House and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, relaxing and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Kikikikiki
Reviews.Content: I loved this place and would stay here again for sure. We arrived late after driving from Miami. I have emailed them before about a room, and upon arrival, they upgraded me to a king suite for no extra charge! The room was huge, bay window, massive bed, stained glass windows... Breakfast by the pool was wonderful. It is steps from Duval Street in the heart of downtown Key West, but on a quiet street. I would have loved to extend my stay....

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: joyce_ch
Reviews.Content: I joined a couple of friends in Key West, and we stayed at Chelsea House. We were checked in by a guy who just did his job and did nothing to make us feel welcome. There is a computer in the lobby, and when I asked if guests could use it, he said it was only for hotel use. Our room was a bit musty smelling and apparently wasn't one of the renovated ones. It was serviceable, and the beds were ok. There were nice shampoos and lotions. The room faced an alley, but it was quiet. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace near the pool at various times of day. The breakfast was bare bones, but the coffee was good. Although in a quiet area, I didn't feel the location was particularly convenient. Yes, it was 2 blocks to Duvall Street, but many of the attractions were at the far end of Duvall.. If it hadn't been so hot and humid, walking might not have been an issue, but we were drenched in sweat by the time we reached most of our destinations. If I visit Key West again, I'll book a place closer to the Mallory Square end of Duvall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Escape close to Duval”
Reviews.Author: masatro
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I vacationed in Key West with two buddies. It was our first trip to Key West and the Chelsea House was an excellent choice for us. The hotel is located two short blocks from Duval street, the main tourist area in Key West. And Mallory square, a venue with nightly entertainment, isn't too far either. We stayed for two nights in one of the newly renovated rooms which had tile floors, two queen beds, a mini fridge, chest of drawers, widescreen flat panel tv and a bathroom with two shower heads (one fix mounted, the other you could pick up freely). And there was plenty of water pressure. During the third day of our stay we moved to another room because of renovation noises coming from a nearby room. The second room we stayed in was more spacious than the first; however, was in need of repair as a portion of one wall looked damaged. It wasn't enough to bother us. The hotel had a clothing optional pool deck -- never saw anyone use it. And an event titled Women Fest took over the pool area one night during our stay -- we were out on a Catamaran snorkeling. We enjoyed our stay and would stay at the Chelsea House again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Cashia32065
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have never been to Key West so when we were deciding where to go, we made Key West our destination. We stayed here for 3 days and it was wonderful. It's close to everything in the Historic town part of town. We only used out car once. We took the took and rented bikes. It was awesome. Our room was always clean and the breakfast was perfect. We will be back. BTW, this place is also known as the Chelsea House. Same address though! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea House is Great!”
Reviews.Author: RWFW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Chelsea House and cant wait for our next trip to Key West so that we can stay there again. We stayed in a Superior Queen on the first floor. The room was very rustic, clean and included a semi-private deck/porch for sitting. The pool area is small but well kept and includes a 2nd floor sundeck. Chelsea House is located about 2 1/2 blocks from Duval Street. Its a pretty good hike to the activities near Mallory Square but we brought our bikes and had no problem getting around. It is very quiet around Chelsea House which we like and this fact along with the existence of the clothing optional sun-deck is why this facility is most appropriate for adults only. Housekeeping did a great job each day. A standard continental breakfast was provided from 0830-1030 each morning which included some very good coffee! The staff did a good job of keeping it stocked for the whole morning. Chelsea House is not a new ,cookie cutter chain hotel/motel. Its a historic Inn and worth the different experience of staying there. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool site, very unfriendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: Schnuffis
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is great, especially at the pool site. That is the good news. The room (superior queen) we had was just average. The air conditioner was so loud that we needed to turn it off at night otherwise sleep was not possible. The continental breakfast is minimal: Some rolls, orange juice, coffee and one selection of yoghurt. The worst thing was the staff: it seems that they are in a permanent bad mood. At the check in there was no welcome no nothing. The guy looked as if we wanted to have something for free. Or did we disturb him doing nothing? Dear management please advise your stuff how to treat GUESTS properly. A warm welcome is the minimum you can expect. But the first thing we heard was that he wanted to see our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love!”
Reviews.Author: PeanutButterLoveBug
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chelsea House was tip-top! We had the basic economy room which was perfect for 2. It was outside, right by the pool. The bed wasnâ€™t the most comfortable, but I sleep on a king size tempurpedic at home so not much can compare to that. Most people have complained the rooms/bathrooms are small, and they are compared to regular hotels, but these are renovated mansions from times when the rooms and bathrooms were small. We found the room very cozy, romantic and very accommodating. The hotel location was great, perfect bicycling distance to everything. We didnâ€™t move our car once the moment we parked it until we departed. There was plenty of space on the bike rack to lock our bikes too and easily accessible. The hotel is very charming and weâ€™d definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holliday Experience”
Reviews.Author: berilkruger
Reviews.Content: We had been to Key West numerous times before and always stayed in one of the Hotels so this time we wanted to stay at a B&B. Parking was in the driveway next to the Inn. When checking in the staff was very cordial and helpful. Gave us some good tips. We rented a moped one block away, so the car stayed at the Inn the whole weekend. Parking is almost non existant in Key West and you can park a moped almost anywhere. The front desk person helped us with tours and recommended some great breakfast restaurants close by. The room was ok and the bathroom was small. We were on the second floor in the front on the veranda where we had coffee each morning and my wife (who gets up very early in the am) read the paper or a book out there. I never made it to the continential breakfast because we went out for breakfast every morning. We did have coffee each morning which was convenient. The girl at the front desk really helped us when we were trying to find the scooner to go out on at sunset. We could not find the dock and she kept calling around and finally found it for us, called a cab and got us there before the boat went out. One of the best things we ever did in Key West. Conch Chowder and drinks (wine or soft drinks) included in the fare. Got some great pics. Saturday and Sunday afternoon were very hot and we went swimming in the pool. Met some very nice people who offered us drinks and treated us as part of the gang. Really enjoyed the pool, not big but adequate. The room was small but remember you don't go to Key West to stay in the room. It was clean and comfortable and even though we were in the front, being on the second floor, the traffic did not bother us. Since this was a holliday weekend, Key West was packed. The hotel staff helped any time we needed help. We felt very secure at this place. We enjoyed ourselves so much, we have already booked reservations at the Chelsea House for this (2008) Memorial Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Please think twice before staying here!”
Reviews.Author: ob1rn
Reviews.Content: I have been to KW numerous times yet never stayed at the Chelsea House. I did a lot of research regarding hotels/B&B's in the area I decided to try something different this time around. The reviews on TA for Chelsea House were not the best but I went against my better judgement & booked a jr. suite with king-sized bed for $200/ night. Got the suite simply because the person I spoke to while booking warned me that the "standard rooms" were really small. Please know that I am not a very hard person to please. On a positive note, check-in went smoothly, parking is plentiful and the pool area is decent. On the flip side, my "jr. suite" was in a word......a joke! Upon entering the room, there were two chairs and a small table with a t.v. on it. The bathroom was so small- it was like they converted a small closet into a bathroom. The bed was hard and linen was very old and dirty looking. The room had french doors and windows however there were no sheer curtains to close when changing....only thick dirty curtains that needed to be pulled most of the time or everyone could see into the room (we were on the first floor). This in turn made the room dark and depressing. The hardwood floors were dirty and sticky to boot! Seriously, I walked in the room barefoot for a few minutes only to discover the bottom of my feet to be flithy!!! We lasted one night and went to another hotel for the rest of our trip. The owner/management of the Chelsea House should be ashamed of themselves. For the money charged to stay here the least they could do is put a fresh coat of paint on the walls and clean up the place. Follow your gut instinct and stay somewhere else! I wish I did.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stay some place else”
Reviews.Author: sandfeet
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking and we should have stayed some place else but... Our stay was for 3 nights and our room was on the second floor over looking the "clothes optional" deck. Hey we are in Key West after all, but if you have issues with this do not stay in room 24 or 25. The rate was $199.00 per night and that is very reasonable by Key West standards. You get what you pay for. The rooms are very, very small, the beds are hard as stones unless you are planning to drink your way through the day you won't mind this. There are NO frills here folks the room are bare of anything. There is no room for you toiletries AT ALL. It is clean but don't look too close. There is no water presure to speak of by the way, so be patient. This property was built in 1891 or 1905 I'm not quite sure, the only thing I know is that is has not been painted at all since then. So don't look for beauty here. IT NEEDS FIXING UP alot of it. They don't know what TLC stands for. Also if you plan to walk anywhere be sure to wear comfortable shoes because this property is very farway from both sides of the island. Duval is 2 blocks but everything else is 10 blocks away. There are positives here: the staff is around but I never saw them so guess they are nice, the pool is very, very nice do bring bug repelent if you decided to stay after dusk, the continental breakfast is good and the coffee is great. Like I said there other places to stay. The mistake we made was booking late during a fishing tournament no less, but if you are palning to go to Key West book early and try not to book by just looking at the picture the hotel provides they are deceiving. It is after all Key West but you hotel stay is part of your vacation too.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't last more than one night...”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfVacations
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, we booked the Chelsea House for our week long Key West vacation. We based our decision on other reviews and price. It didn't work out...the check-in process was easy and the staff was very friendly. Our room, however, was too, too, too, too small. There was barely enough room to walk around the queen size bed. There was NOWHERE to put our suitcases. The bathroom was fine, with the exception of the terrible water pressure...I think it was the shower head. The complimentary breakfast was decent, and the pool area was okay...a little too shady for me. I like that the hotel is pet friendly and enjoyed socialzing with some of the pooches who were there on vacation. We checked out the next day...my fiance couldn't take how small the room was. The staff was courteous and helpful in suggesting other hotels to stay at. They didn't penalize us for checking out early. They suggested the newly renovated Albury Court, which is owned by the same investor. We went to check AC out and loved it. Overall, we weren't impressed with the cleanliness of the town of KW. We're not rushing to go back there...

Reviews.Title: “Agree with O.K. ?!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: jl_1018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea last year. Thought I would contribute about our stay. We were given the room directly in the front of the house ... off the porch. Seems to me it used to be a dining room?!? turned hotel room. Very basic accomodations, little run down and no frills. Bed a little old and creeky, hard. Nothing fancy or new about the rooms. The toughest thing about this room location was that you hear everything on the street. The traffic and people being loud walking past at all hours of the night (and lets not forget the roosters at 5am). The small grounds were nice and pool was nice and refreshing. Nontheless, we made the best of it. We love Key West and had a great time despite. We weren't in the room very much but there is much to say for a 'quiet' good nights sleep. You can walk to the corner and rent bikes to get everywhere you need to go. It's really fun to just bike through the neighborhoods and look at the houses. Just beautiful. Everything is within bike riding distance. We biked to the public beach, Truman Annex - Fort Taylor (I think) - you pay a dollar to get in and there are beaches to lay out. Not too many people here. The sand is very rocky though ... but it could of been due to the hurricane Key West was recovering from. We also went parasailing at the pier area. Good time. The front desk attendant at The Chelsea recommended having breakfast at Blue Heaven on Thomas Ave. I absolutely loved this restaurant. I would eat bkst, lunch and dinner here. THANK YOU for this suggestion. Delish!! Homemade bread, fresh squeezed oj and an eggs bene with key lime hollandaise. WOW. Enjoy a drink at the outside bar while you wait!! Anyways, probably would not stay here again. I think I would pay more money for something a little nicer -- but just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jimDavis
Reviews.Content: " I have been coming to key west for 10 years and this is by far the best place I have stayed at." The staff are very helpfull.The rooms and property are clean and the location is great."

Reviews.Title: “Management Change!”
Reviews.Author: Desire2
Reviews.Content: We had written a negative review of the hotel! Fought with our credit card company to delete the charge to no avail. Visa/ AE will protect you! My discussions had been with the on site manager. Before going to the BBB called hotel one more time to resolve problem! Ended up with the General Manger of Historical Inns and he recognized the problem and made a resolution! The on-site manager has been fired right after our stay! Give them a chance but I stand by my original comments! Both the General Manager and I wished we had talked earlier!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: claudelux
Reviews.Content: Ideally located as it is very close to Duval street and the sunset pier being in walking distance (15-20 minutes). Parking is not a problem. Rooms however are rather small. Very friendly and helpful staff at reception. A special of this hotel: Breakfast is outdoor at the (small) pool!

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms ok, but most not”
Reviews.Author: kristinc51
Reviews.Content: The Good: Clean, larger rooms in the main (historic) part of the house are nice. The Bad: The Inn has tried to capitalize on high demand during high season by expanding the historic part of the house with cheap, very small add-on rooms. If you get one of the larger, historic rooms they are very nice. But the newer rooms are small and in some cases dank. The first room we were given stepped out onto the driveway and 4 feet beyond that a high fence. They kindly gave us another room (same room but 2 floors up) so at least we were looking out into the garden of the inn next door. But both room were very small, tiny bathroom, small tv, loud a/c. The bed was not in good condition -- wobbly and slightly un-level. After 2 nights we offered to pay for an upgrade to a king size bed, hoping it would be better. We were told we could not upgrade because, while there were rooms available, the cleaning staff were about to leave for the day and thus would not be able to clean our old room in case they could sell our old room that night (not likely in low season), but that we could upgrade the next day. This was not stellar service. We were so angry we didn't want to talk to the front staff anymore. Later upon closer inspection we saw that the bed frame was just all out of whack; tried to fix it but needed equipment. Breakfast is included but about as cheap as could be (cheap danishes, bagels, oj, coffee). The Summary: Especially in high season, there are other places to stay for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: abbeyrue
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews here and was kind of reluctant to book a room here, but I'm glad I did. I picked it because they offer free on-site parking combined with its proximity to Duval Street and most of the island's attractions. Its also very easy to find because it's on U.S. 1. Though the price for a room was high, we had a great experience. Our room was cramped, but you don't go to Key West to stay inside. But when we were inside, it was comfortable and clean. The breakfast isn't anything spectacular, but it worked out fine. I think the biggest reason I liked it is because it was a nice change from the typical chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - cannot wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: marcyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea House on our honeymoon. They upgraded us to a larger room at no charge which was much appreciated as the initial room we booked was very small. We feel we got a very good value for our money and plan to return in the future. The grounds were very pretty, parking was more then adequate. You don't need a car in Key West, so we left our car in the parking lot the whole week we were there and rented a moped which was great. We stayed in room #6 which was in the main house upstairs with a pool view. The bathroom was small as mentioned in previous reviews with no place to put tolietries but this would be my only complaint. The hotel is in a great location with just a short walk to Duval. The pool was small and a bit warm however we didn't come to Key West to do laps in a pool. The a/c worked great and the furnishing were nice with plenty of room to put your clothes in the dresser as well as the tolietries from the bathroom. There was also an in room fridge which we used. We only had the breakfast on our last day there however it was decent for a continental breakfast (bagels, yogurts, muffins, coffee tea and juice). We will definately stay at the Chelsea House on our next trip to Key West

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaParks
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has character, romance & location. Our room was beautiful, large with a king size bed. We were on our honeymoon and although we had reserved a Supreme Queen we were given a King room, which was great, overlooking the quaint street and surrounded by trees! All the rooms appear to be charming with semi private balconies. Beautiful gardens, sundecks and pool. We found the location great, about 20 mins walk to Mallory Square and that all important â€˜Sunset Spotâ€™ and far enough away to be quiet and quaint. We would definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cosplaymom
Reviews.Content: We booked Chelsea House for our 25th wedding anniversary planning on having a romantic 3 nights. We were lured by the promise of a restored historic home with modern amenities. The in room ac was nice, as was the flat screen TV. But clearly, someone who has never stayed in a hotel re-did these rooms. We booked a "standard queen" (which provoked an off color comment from the front desk clerk when we checked in. I was glad there were no children around). The room was located at the top off the stairs facing the street. The plus there was we had a nice balcony. The many minuses included the really obnoxious traffic noise and the spot lights that shown into the room all night long. The drapes over the window were much too small to help with either problem (in fact they barely blocked the window at all). The room contained one dresser, which was a totally inadequate horizontal service and had only one luggage rack, so most of our belongings were relegated to the floor. The bathroom was abysmal! I have a closet that is bigger. There were no shelves to hold anything, so we were in constant fear of having out toothbrushes fall in the toilet. You couldn't bend over in the bathroom without having to worry about poking an eye out on the towel rack. The "continental breakfast" was also sad. Mushy fruit and warm orange juice along with some pastries. I have seen better in much less expensive hotels. The chicken that joined us for breakfast was fun though. All in all, worth about $75/night. Too bad we paid twice that.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique B&B”
Reviews.Author: SurreyGirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only two nights at the Chelsea House but would happily have stayed far longer. We found the reception staff to be very pleasant and helpful, the room was great , the pool area was gorgeous (as an ardent sun worshipper, I can't relate to one of the previous comments posted, and I've the tan to prove it!), free off street parking and a beautiful building to boot. Admittedly the bathroom was a little tired, but very clean, and the breakfast was basic but more than sufficient. Myself and my friend both felt it did justice to Key West and we look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “If just being old classifies as historic...”
Reviews.Author: realbri
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this by saying that I am not a picky person, and I don't expect every hotel to be the Ritz, especially at lower price points, but I do expect common courtesy and truth in advertising. Let me start by saying that the hotel needs a meeting with their employee's on how to treat guests. The check in put me off at the start. I show up to have the guy behind the counter act as if I was inconveniencing him by checking in. Try greeting your guests by at least welcoming them. He gave me a poor explanation of the hotel, other than to say it would be an extra $10 for every hour past checkout if I was late and a drama queen attitude. Here's the lowdown. If you take photos at the right angles, you can make any place look great. The only think historic about this place was the exterior. They have taken every public room away, chopped it up, and jambed in as many hotel rooms as possible into every sqaure inch. There is and entrance hall and stair with two chairs, and that's it. I got a 'superior' queen room. It was superior to sleeping in my car, yes. It had a balcony overlooking the parking lot, some renovations that looked to be done by a handy man and a few trips to Home Depot. It was dark, depressing, small and just dank. It had a shower that was 30" square with those plastic Home Depot shower walls. The mattress was old. It had no safe and a window a/c that was loud enough to keep you up. Yes, they put a cheap, empty, mini fridge in and a 19" flat screen and act as if it's renovated. On the positive side, the room was clean. Congrats to the cleaning staff. I had hoped to stay two night for a romantic weekend. I didn't even take the bags out of the car. It killed any romance. The best was two pool towels they put out with a sign saying that if you want to keep one, they'll bill you $20. Who would ever want to take their $1.50 towel from Target home with them I thought? The pool is a rectangle in shade, nothing more. It is servicable, but not inviting. For $159 night in June, they really have to be kidding. There are better places all around this one. Breakfast is basic 'continental'. When voicing my displeasure, instead of getting any kind of apology, all I got was more attitude. If your in college and are packing a few guys in to crash during fantasy fest, that's one thing. If you are looking for a nice romantic place, don't be fooled. It's post WW2 housing at best. Sorry, but historic or renovated it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool not much else”
Reviews.Author: MoonlightGrahams
Reviews.Content: I wish I could be more positive in my review but after staying here for a week I found this place to mostly dissapointing based on the price and overall lack of charm for on "historic inn". The positives...great location a block away from the classier end of duval street, the small pool and gardens were nice. The negatives...our room was in the cottages which are not historic at all and not kept up (peeling paint, old mattress & linens. We did stay in one of the smaller rooms but wow what it ever small if I had to say it was maybe 10 x 9. The breakfast was lame for the price of the place. I was hoping for a more charming experience but we found it to be just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: hibiscusflwr
Reviews.Content: Chelsea House was perfect for our wedding. We got married and honeymooned there for a week. Located more towards the Atlantic side of the island right off of US1. Just two blocks away from Duval. I suggest renting a bicycle to get around, otherwise, it is a lot of walking if you need to get to the other side several times or multiple times in a day for sunset sails, dry tortugas, the main bars, etc..There is a CVS just up the road and two bike rental places. They also have good parking. We stayed in the Conch Suite. It was very nice and very Key West. Great, not cheesey decor, wood floors, great patio area, lots of drawers and closet space. The bathroom was updated but tiny with a hairdryer. Needed more shelves for toiletries. This may be weird to say but I also didn't know that such cheap toilet paper existed. Our favorite spot was the beautiful, mid-size pool area with a upper level sundeck. Covered seating area was available and we used it often since we could not pick up the wireless internet signal from our room. Our room was always cleaned with fresh towels and the housekeeping staff was great. The front desk staff was ok. They were not good about booking our Dry Tortugas trip and had promised us a special surprise in our room when we booked since it was our wedding/honeymoon but there was nothing...not the end of the world either. We just took care of booking our own activities and it went great. Our family members that were there stayed at both the Key Lime Inn and the Merlin Guest house. The Key Lime was cute, small, and good if you didn't want to spend as much, however, there were roaches on the last day our parents stayed..yuck. The Merlin suite was nice with an elevated bed with fabric streaming from the posts. Both had pools. We would definitely consider staying there again but would also look for other similar type places to try out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDanny
Reviews.Content: Stayed Valentine's night 2006. This is a very quaint/quiet Historical Inn. However I did find the price a bit high ($219 on a Wednesday night). Beware, no kids allowed here. We were traveling with young 8 month old and were not told about it in advance. We got there to our surprise, they do not allow kids. They let it slide for us because it was a young infant and it was for 1 night only.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Shazra
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 31st Jan & 1st Feb 2007. Very clean quaint hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly and nice continental breakfast. Nice pool and gardens. Room fairly small and very clean and all non smoking, we stayed in number 16 so could sit right outside the door. Bed slightly soft for us and no wardrobe. As we only stayed two nights, this didn't cause us a problem, probably would have done if we had stayed any longer. Near enough to the nightlife (Duval Street and Mallory Square) but far enough away to get peace and quiet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the place”
Reviews.Author: travelerin
Reviews.Content: Typical KW guesthouse atmosphere. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ick!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerEastCoast
Reviews.Content: What an unusual experience. First they screwed up our reservation and had us only for two nights instead of three. Fortunately they were able to accommodate us for the third night. Second, I had requested a room that allowed our small dog, which they also did not have listed. Fortunately, we were able to leave our dog at home. The room we had was almost empty of furniture. There was one desk chair, a king bed (nice), an armoire that held a tv and a small rattling refrigerator sitting on the floor. There were no closets. None. Just four hooks on the wall. We had our clothes and towels draped all over the room. No internet unless you have a Wi-Fi laptop. The bathroom shower trinkled water (I know Key West has water issues, but really...) but water came out full force at the sink tap. They don't even provide drinking glasses in your room, plastic or otherwise. The rattling window air conditioner did not work. It made the room cold, but didn't remove any of the moisture so the room was cold and clammy. The continental breakfast in minimal, coffee, juice (orange only) and various rolls. On the weekend, if you're lucky you might get a yogurt or fruit until they run out. With taxes, this room was over $250 per night. Although it was close walking distance to Duvall St., you can DEFINITELY do better.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Key West Bed and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: josta3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place in Room #12 for 6 nights over New Years. The room was very clean, service prompt and very friendly, and the grounds were very well-kept, maintained and clean. The king mattress was comfortable. The place overall presents a charming "Old Key West" feel, with swaying palms which we loved. The "contintential breakfast" left a bit to be desired considering the cost of the rooms. The orange juice was too much like "Tang", but the coffee was good. Pastries, yogurt, and apples was for the rest of the breakfast. The toiltries in the baths were a really nice touch. They do have a clothing optional roof-top deck, but women must wear their tops around the pool area even though this is an "adults only" place. Go figure. We found this a bit surprising for Key West. Because of this, we attempted to book elsewhere for Fantasy Fest and are returning here only because the other places were alreay sold out. It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the place to the center of the action on Duval Street (although Duval itself is 3 or 4 blocks away) There is a CVS a block away, and two moped rentals within 3 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: sulluburka
Reviews.Content: Overall.....Great Place to stay! Just make sure you take a tour of the place and pick the room that meets your needs the best. My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at Chelsea. The front desk staff was extremely friendly. She showed us their available rooms and allowed us to pick the room we liked. She gave us an overview of Key West and her recommendation for water sports, restaurants, etc. We picked a pool facing room (which I strongly recommend). We had an economy room which was quite small for the price. But the room was spotlessly clean. Chelsea is only two blocks from Duval Street where all the action in Key West is. All the major attractions are within walking distance. Breakfast was very basic. Wireless Internet access was barely available from the room. But it was good in the lobby. So we had to go to the lobby to access Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea House is the Keys”
Reviews.Author: NP116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea House in December for 5 days. We have traveled to the Keys many times before but never stayed at a B&B, so we (I) decided to give one a try. I spent many hours researching on line and finally decided on the Chelsea House. It is one of the few B&B's in Key west that provide parking (even thought you don't need a car in the keys) and also because of the many good reviews on trip advisor. When I booked the room, I was told it was a queen room, newly decorated. The room was very nice, second floor and in the front of the buiding. It was very small!! I really don't think the bed is a queen because my husband and I hardly fit into it. He rolled over and his leg almost went out the window onto the porch! Unfortunately, the roosters across the street kept us up the entire night!! They don't just crow at dawn and the car noise from the street was pretty distracting. The next day we moved into a room in the back which was much bigger, king sized bed, bigger bathroom and much quieter. Unfortunately I was charged more tor this room than the one I booked but still recieved a few bucks off. The keys are very quiet the first three weeks in December, so maybe I should have been more persistent about the price break. The rooms are clean, friendly staff, good location about two blocks from Duval down the southern end. The breakfast was good, mostly bagels, english muffins and fruit, great coffee. All in all a good place. One suggestion, do not stay in the front rooms, very noisy!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: lucilee
Reviews.Content: After extensive research on Trip Advisor, I decided on staying her. While there are many other bed and breakfasts to try, after my experience here, I don't believe I'll try another. I contacted them directly, as i was coming to key west for a wedding . The girl who helped me book a room was very friendly and informative. I booked a superior queen (#21). I have never stayed at a b&b before (I'm a ritz carlton type of girl)and was not sure what to expect, I did not want to stay at a chain, as I wanted to have a key west type of experience. I was very, very happy with my entire stay here. The room was very nice with a larger-than-expected private bathroom. It was very clean and had nice toiletries. (FYI-bath had an attached hairdryer). The cleanliness was noted, as anything else with dirt or a strange hair completely grosses me out! The room also had a nice tv w/remote. My favorite part was the "private" balcony. Not like a hotel, but there was a separate door leading out to a patio which had two chairs and a table. The room also came with an empty large mini-fridge, which I stocked w/diet coke, water and beer. Because there is no-smoking inside, it was very nice, relaxing, and convenient to simply open my door and sit outside w/a drink (or coffee in the morning) and read. Re the morning: although it states that the breakfast (continental) is between 830 and 1030, I found that it was ready by 8am. I can't speak to the quality of breads/danishes as I don't eat breakfast, but they looked fresh and plentiful. Most importantly, the coffee was very good and HOT! As I was only staying for a couple of nights, I didn't feel the need to have my room "made up" every day. All it took was the "privacy please" note on my door and a quick word with housekeeping. She was such a nice lady and INSISTED on giving me more towels (even pool towels even though I wasn't using the pool) and asked repeatedly if I need anything! This is an adult-only facility. While I didn't venture up(stairs) to the clothing-optional pool deck, I really appreciated the calm and relaxing atmosphere--NOT a fan of screaming kids. Re cleanliness- while sitting out on "my" patio, I did notice that there was always someone cleaning, sweeping, etc. This is a very well run, professional establishment. Everyone I came in contact with smiled and asked how I was doing. This b&b is on the southern/more quiet side of duval. Its still within walking distance to all you want to do (I recommend the Hemingway House tour) and if you find yourself (which I did) on the rowdier side of duvall, if you don't feel like walking back at the end of the night, its only few-dollar cab ride back. Upon checking out, I had the front desk watch my bag (as my flight was later) and the nice lady insisted on putting it right in front of her desk so she "could keep an eye" on it--very nice! Finally, I ate brunch at Alices Restaurant everyday--highly recommended. Have the Eggs Benedict Blackstone-TRUST ME

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: victor11
Reviews.Content: After driving around Key West with no clue for a place to stay and so many options, my wife called her brother who mentioned he had stayed at The Chelsea House. We decided to give it a shot. We were shown two different rooms, one for $99, which was a bit small and another for $119. We chose the larger room which had a wrap around porch that was shared by the room next to ours. The hotel is very old and parts look like they have been painted over hundreds of times. Still, it seemed very clean and our room was nice. The room faced Truman street which is one of the main roads through Key West so there is a bit of traffic going by but nothing that the AC unit couldn't drown out. There is a church across the street that harbors some of the Key West chickens. The roosters crow often and if you're a light sleeper they may wake you up... EARLY! The Chelsea House is located close to the upper section of Duvall St. so is within walking distance of the popular spots to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to say in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tewks
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea House is a great place to stay in Key West. It has the charm of old Key West, great service and helpful staff, and amenities you don't find at most guest houses on the island. We have been to Key West about a dozen times, and stayed at the big hotels on the island, small guest houses and some in-between places. By far Chelsea House is the best. It has a great location, only 2 blocks off of Duval Street, about half-way between the two ends of the island. The grounds are nice, the pool area is nice, and the free wireless and breakfast were very pleasant surprises. Additionally, every room has a porch or deck area which is nice if you want to not have to interact with the other guests. The clothing optional sunning deck is separate, so those guests who do not go for such don't even have to know it's there. If you are not used to Key West you might be disappointed, as the island's laid-back style permeates to almost every lodging on the island. Is the Chelsea House a 5 diamond luxury hotel? Of course not, but for Key West, it is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tropical Suite. When I opened the door, I thought is was lovely. Beautiful four poster bed, pretty blue walls, full sized kitchen, and a private porch. Also two large ceiling fans kept the air fresh. I brought my Shitzu and he loved the space. On-site parking was included which I found to be a huge bonus. I like to walk so the distance from the main attractions was not a problem. Chelsea House is a very old property, so there were minor housekeeping problems, but not enough to ruin my stay. I thought the carpet could have been cleaner and there was no hand soap in the bathroom. The air-conditioned vent leaked from condensation. It would have been nice if the room had contained some Key West Tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “Chased out of our rooms with construction noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very excited when we first checked into Chelsea House. The complex looked nice, the rooms were fine and clean, and the staff was kind. We were there for a two night stay and we had guests visiting from overseas. They told us that they would like to upgrade our rooms and gave us two rooms on the second floor opening to a verandah area. However, the first morning we woke up to loud construction noise at 9 am right outside of our rooms where they seemed to be completely demolishing one of the two stairways leading to the verandah area. There were construction workers all around walking and talking. We tried to accommodate the noise and went to breakfast hoping that the construction was out of dire necessity as they did not warn us about a possible construction work when we reserved our rooms or while checking in. When we came back that night we saw that the stairway was entirely removed. We took a deep breath and thought that that was the end of it. The next morning, however, we again woke up to loud construction noise. This time, it started at 8 am and was coming from the first floor, the second floor (verandah area), and the roof. The construction workers were removing part of the wooden floor on both levels, and they also removed a sizeable area of the roof right in front of our room. Our guests, who were visiting from overseas, packed up immediately and were ready to check out before they even had their breakfast. When we asked the reception about the construction work, they told us that they did not expect it to be very intense. First of all, we find it very unprofessional and insensitive to book rooms in a hotel without warning that there will be construction work. This is a hotel after all where people stay for a limited time. Is it too much to expect peace and quiet when you are on vacation? Secondly, if the reception staff did not really know about the construction, then it is a serious management mistake as the reception staff are the ones who take reservations and place guests into available rooms. Thirdly, they could have acted more promptly and changed our rooms to get us away from the construction zone; it is a large complex with rooms available in two different houses. Unfortunately, our tolerance on the first day did not do any good for us during our stay at Chelsea House. Simply saying that they are sorry for the inconvenience does not necessarily make up for the dreadful experience and disappointment we had at Chelsea House Pool and Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Visit to Chelsea House”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyesSmiling
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute with Chelsea house and got a great rate of $99.00 plus taxes for 2 nights. Having left our previous hotel because of the dirt of the place we were delighted with this. The room was an excellent size with two queen beds, large TV, fridge and nice size bathroom. There was also a table and two chairs outside the room, not quite a patio area but nice touch all the same. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ok but a little boring. The pool area was well kept and very relaxing. The location was very convenient, close to Duval but not too close. I would definitely return to the Chelsea house.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time to Key West. Didn't know where to stay. Tried to do as much research ahead of time. Read great reviews on Chelsea House. After arriving at the "hotel", which our family later renamed as the "oldest, scariest house on the island,â€� I kept wondering if we were at the same place that was listed in the reviews. It was so run down. It didnâ€™t look anything like what was shown on the website. How could people make return visits to this place? I love how they list that the place was ideal for weddings. I can't even imagine getting married in this tiny dump. Our room was so dirty. The bathroom was so small that the sink was in the bedroom. I accidentally spilled some water on the wood floor after using the sink and I used a towel to wipe it up. The towel was black from dirt. The wood floor was beyond dirty. The bed was as hard as a rock. No blanket on the bed. The security lights were shining into the windows all night long. We woke up to dead cockroaches on the floor. We were told that there was a rap around porch outside our room. They failed to mention was that it was a public porch and we woke up to people having their coffee outside our bedroom window. The room faced the main street and there was traffic all night long. The breakfast involved stale rolls and weak coffee. We fortunately only had to endure one evening here. Loved Key West, but would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Chelsea House”
Reviews.Author: sundog3
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at a North end hotel for 4 nights and the Chelsea House 3 night starting on New Years Day of 06. After one night in the hotel with kids screaming, diving into 3 ft. of water head first, parents ignoring them or worse teaching them to dive into the pool posted NO DIVING, jets flying so low over our heads and the nearest big beach was unfit due to young people sleeping on the beach with NO working bathrooms. Long story short, we stopped in at Chelsea H. the second evening in K.W. to see if we could check in early and a wonderful girl named Amy upgraded our room to a full kitchen,private balcony so we wouldn't have to change rooms. It came with a kitty named Evil. If you didn't want her to visit she would know. The only complaint I could make is I agree that more fresh fruit and cereal would be welcome. Bananas, grapefruit, grapes. More than just apples. We hope to stay there for a full week next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean and Walking Distance to Everywhere.....”
Reviews.Author: Delain
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Key West, we stayed out on Highway #1 at a hotel - we had to take a cab or bus into town once or twice a day. This year we decided we would stay as close to Duval as we could and The Red Rooster Inn was available. I had trouble making reservations on the website, and called - they were very helpful. Once we arrived, we found the staff even more friendly and helpful. I loved the little refridgerator, which we stocked with water and beer from nearby CVS, and with leftovers from some very fine restaurants (if you ask, they will let you use their microwave to heat things up). Our room was made up everyday before 11am, while we enjoyed breakfast and the deck above the pool. The convenience of the location and the wonderful service make this our first choice for next years trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Place”
Reviews.Author: psmdChicago
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 day stay at the Chelsea House. On the plus side; cozy and clean,fairly close to Duval street and other attractions. Negatives; Our little room opened right up to the breakfast/patio area. If we opened our curtain to look outside about 20 people near the pool and patio would look right back at us. For the price I would've expected a room a little less exposed to the public. Overall good experience would stay there again

HotelInfo.Name: Chelsea House Pool & Gardens
HotelInfo.Address: 709 Truman Avenue, Key West, FL 33040 (Formerly Red Rooster Inn)
